story:
CAPE CORPORATE TOURS PTY LTD

Once upon a time, a red lipped, black haired vixen, bumped into a rugged Harley-Davidson biker boy and magic started to happen. Coming from a six stared hospitality & tourism background, teaming up with Jason who ran a Harley-Davidson Chauffeur Tours and Rentals Agency in Cape Town, was a no brainer. 

WHAT WE DO - 

 We facilitate Harley-Davidson Chauffeur Tours, up to 100 bikes per tour and rent out a variety of Harley-Davidson's and BMW GS Motorbikes.  A Chauffeur Tour is when someone sits as a papillon passenger on the back of a Harley-Davidson bike, whilst being driven, across some of the most beautiful scenery in the world. What a better way to experience the outdoors, then to do it with complete freedom and the wind through your hair. 

More panoramic then any car or bus and bound to get you noticed, vibing the streets of the Mother City. Our Harley-Davidson Chauffeur Tours have taken off like "Bat Out Of Hell" and we desperately need funds to keep up with demand and expand our business not only nationally but globally. 

We specialize in creating  tour itineraries for our corporate clients and tourists, so they not only get to experience the true essence of their chosen travel destination but also get to rock any corporate event. Please see media coverage links provided below. 

BUY YOUR RED CHERRY SWALLOW MOTORCYCLE RALLY BADGE NOW!

To help us raise funds, we are selling our limited edition Red Cherry Swallow Motorcycle Badges made of solid stainless steel. These look exquisite on any leather jacket or to add to your collection of rally badges, in support of our international funding campaign. 



THESE ARE EXCLUSIVE TO CAPE CORPORATE TOURS ONLY!

These badges are not for retail and are given to our clients as a token of appreciation from Red Cherry Swallow Foundation, for going on a selection of our tours. Cape Corporate Tours founded the charity, in the hope of actively making a difference in the strive for social upliftment and peace amongst communities.

For every $17 badge bought, 5% will go into helping our social upliftment projects we run through our non-profit, non-government funded organization, Red Cherry Swallow Foundation.




HUGE SAVINGS!

For bids of $50 - $100, you will receive a signed voucher from myself, exclusive to the Indiegogo Campaign. This voucher gives you a once off  10% discount off,  per booking, on our famous chauffeur tours at any of our stores worldwide.

 As we cater for tour groups, of up to 100 bikes per tour, this would be considered as an individual booking, so you do the math!

HOW TO GET THE BEST VALUE FROM YOUR VOUCHER!

The value a person gets depends on the volume of the tour. Its  10% off whether you have one bike or 20.  So for example lets say you wanted to do our 2 hour chauffeur tour with  say 20 friends @ 599 per bike, you would make a saving of R2400 on the group tour which is great, especially if your a corporate wanting to book something a little different for that team building event and save a few rand/dollars.  


So the more bikes you use on a tour the more you save! But, thats just the cost and saving for a tour which is our lowest priced product. As its more expensive to hire a Harley-Davidson and ride on your own, so the discount becomes more valuable especially if you and your group want to do a bit of bike touring. 


The "lifetime: condition is a bonus as once you use this cash to market the business and drive more volume, our prices decrease which means more saving to people with a larger discounted saving.


If you are currently living or plan to travel to South Africa on holiday or on business, you can redeem your voucher for your tour or rental in Johannesburg, Durban or Cape Town. 


This fantastic offer also extends to the rentals of our Harley-Davidson fleet which is a home away from home for most bikers on holiday. Please note that a valid bike license will have to be provided. 


For bids of $101 and above, you will get an even better deal with a jaw dropping 20% discount off, any tours or rentals. If we'r not currently at a desired destination, fear not as we will be there in due course which is why these vouchers can only go up in value. 

These vouchers have a lifetime guarantee ,  but have a once off use, so use wisely my friends. Corporates your included, so lets spice up those christmas parties and team building do's!


A RED CHERRY SWALLOW BADGE WILL BE SENT, ALONGSIDE YOUR ELECTRONIC VOUCHER. 


HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE SPENT - 

The funds raised here on Indiegogo, will go towards the opening of our first head quarters here in Cape Town. As our motto is, go big or go home, the funds will also go into fast tracking us into opening up a store near you! 


The country with the highest amount of bids will be the next country in which we will open our next store, within the next 18 months. With the opening of every new store worldwide, so follows our Red Cherry Swallow Foundation. For every country that has our flagship store, 5 % of the stores net profits will go into helping their direct local community. We like to call this, spreading the biker love.



RED CHERRY SWALLOW FOUNDATION
"No wealth or position can long endure unless it benefits all those on whom it effects" - Napoleon Hill. 

 As Cape Corporate Tours, prides itself on business-to-business interaction, Jason and myself teamed up with the infamous Mr Mozli. His old school famous BBQ methods, has tantalized the taste buds of folk all over the world, giving our visitors a taste of true South Africa culture.

We of all people know the harsh realities of life and the difficulties one shares, starting up your own business.  It's a mean old world out there, but if we can help make it be a better place and inspire other entrepreneurs to do the same, then thats a jolly good start ! The larger our  Cape Corporate Tours empire gets, the more  social upliftment projects we can facilitate, with 5 % of our net profits going into the on going funding of the foundation.

Unemployment statistics in South Africa are at an all time high, boarding on the poorest in the world. This has had devastating effects on social wellbeing amongst our community. Our goal is to reach out, and give back the hope that was once shared between a nation, many moons ago. 

WHAT DOES THE FOUNDATION DO?

What the foundation does, is create and set up small businesses for the unemployed. We source our unemployed candidates living in townships by good referrals from old employees etc. We teach our new recruits the basic principles of running a small business and train all new employees on customer service and improving sales and marketing skills. 

FOR SEEING THE FUTURE - 

Once management level is reached, the most suitable candidate will in turn, take over and run the business on behalf of the Red Cherry Swallow Foundation. When the business is making a healthy monthly turn over, and all overheads accounted for, any left over net profit from the small business will then go into funding another entrepreneurial incentive program or other social upliftment scheme. This allows us to maintain our non profit  ethics however building business in the private sector. The result, a business network that not only contributes to the countries dire economy, but also sets an example of creative ways of easing unemployment. 

CURRENT PROJECTS UP AND RUNNING - 

We have already had great success with our new project - Operation Cheese Stick. RCS invested in some beautiful wicker baskets in supporting the blind school and recruited the wonderful Yum Yum. Yum Yum has already sold over 200 delicious freshly baked cheese sticks, feeding our early morning rush hour friends at designated robots around the city. Any left over cheese sticks are given to the hungry and homeless at the end of the day.

WHERE WILL DONATIONS GO TO? 

Any donations given to Red Cherry Swallow Foundation will go towards implementing our new mechanical apprenticeship program for older children who have dropped out of school, provide help in writing resume for potential jobs and teach interview skills to the community.  As education is the vital key to any growing economy, helping support schools that are in dire need of resources, helps build a prosperous future for our next generation. 

Any donations given will be disbursed accordingly and funds closely monitored, that they are being spend affectively and responsibly. Being the organization we are, our books will be audited yearly for our clients to oversee where their donations are being spent. 

You can follow our progress on:

 Red Cherry Swallow Foundation 


Media:
Goodhope FM
GOOD HOPE FM 1
GOOD HOPE FM 2

From everyone here at Cape Corporate Tours, we would like to thank each and everyone of you for your support. Thank you x


For legal reasons, please note that Cape Corporate Tours Pty Ltd is in no way affiliated with any Harley-Davidson dealerships.

story:
My name is Jessica,

I have an opportunity to run a wonderful rustic cabin get-away, nestled in the majestic Russian River redwoods of Northern California. The warmth of this community and it’s natural beauty are carried on from generation through generation. These attributes of beauty in nature, and bringing you back to a simpler life, are just a few of the qualities that attract me to this area.

My dream is to get rural families out of the city and into a place where they can relax and enjoy the great outdoors. Jessica's Cabin on the hill provides peace and tranquility, without the distraction of technology. It’s a wonderful place in the majestic redwoods for anyone wanting to escape the hectic pace of metropolitan life. It’s a short walk down to the Russian River to sunbathe and swim where true separation from stress is key to enjoying life.

If you find that you are hitting unexpected difficulties in life, then it is time you need to get away and relax. Jessica's cabin is a destination where guests can put their troubles away for a while and enjoy the best of life. We know it’s time for you to get away for a moment into the beautiful redwoods of northern California. We offer a perfect rustic cabin to accommodate small groups or individuals. You can easily secure your moment for tranquility easily online, it’s easy and convenient. We feature a warm and inviting cabin waiting for you and is stocked with everything you need to come in and make yourself at home.

The spacious deck features a panoramic view and is a perfect perch to sip on your favorite beverage. You will eventually surrender your woes as the birds singing their love song, while watching the squirrels playing. When the morning fog caresses the great trees, you can imagine the past flowing through the long, misty shadows … Vast redwood forests flourished through the lush and humid North America … After the final ice age, a last stand here in the sustaining climate along the Pacific coast.

At Jessica's Cabin we will be your stewards to peace and tranquility for you, your family and friends. Our rustic cabin filled with our ingredients will leave you hesitant to return to the concrete jungle. We know you will be back because we too know how healing and energizing this experience can be. We too are familiar with the city life and that why this retreat is essential.

I have put down a substantial amount of money and hard work towards maintaining this jewel of a property. Unfortunately I do not have the remaining funds necessary to make it happen. My dream is to preserve this cabin in it’s glorious niche in nature for generations to come. I need further financial assistance and I am asking for your donation so I can keep this cabin. Donations of any size are a blessing. We need financial assistance to assure that this cabin will be given the love and attention it requires.

story:
My name is Wisly Jasmin, 

I have studied agronomy and business management (now a Haitian farmer).  I have been working for 4 years doing different agricultural businesses to help farmers. From my experiences, I want to focus on what works better and do them on larger scale. Normally, I am Social Entrepreneur. 

It's very difficult to have access to loans in my country (mainly for farming) and the interest rate are very high form (23%to 66% a year, in some rare occasion you might find an 18% from NGO or other difficult loans). 

This contribution will help me be able to save my investment from now that are 6,328 USD, keep the farm going until it start bring cash in, and plant my important products (they bring a lot of income) hot peppers and vegetables. 

The farm is a 5 acres of land with irrigations system on it (I am repairing) next to a river. 

Your Contributions will help me do these: 

Object Units Quantity2 Unit cost ( in Gourdes) Total Price en Gourdes Total Price in USD %
Employees month   2.00   15,000.00   30,000.00   638.30 USD 14%
Part time jobs days   180.00   600.00   108,000.00   2,297.87 USD 51%
Pumps (diesel) object   1.00   30,000.00   30,000.00   638.30 USD 14%
Springlers object   28.00   300.00   8,400.00   178.72 USD 4%
Hot Pepper seeds pounds   1.00   15,000.00   15,000.00   319.15 USD 7%
fence wires pounds   30.00   700.00   21,000.00   446.81 USD 10%
 Total  Units quantity Unit cost  HTG  212,400.00  4,519.15 USD 100%
So my needs in money are 4,519.15 USD. 

By helping this business to be self-sustainable, I engage myself to invest 20% of my net profit in local system that make loans for women and small business in my area in Jeremie. 

80%, I ll use it to rent more space and grow the business. 

 's a big challenge for I have many friends from United States and Africa that expect me to succeed for they see opportunities sitting here and we haitians can't them. 

I have made huge sacrifices like not being able to put food on my table. If ever like a Hurricane crashed everything, i will not be afraid to start over and almost the infrastructures will be already there. 


Income Statement of Intensive Agricultural Farm

 Personals    399,600.00    8,502.13 USD  
Employees month 12   15,000.00    180,000.00    3,829.79 USD
part time jobs day 366   600.00    219,600.00    4,672.34 USD
 Total Expense    644,600.00    13,714.89 USD  
 Income    1,150,000.00    24,468.09 USD  
 Peppers   3 acres    15,000    50.00    750,000.00    15,957.45 USD  
 Okra   1 acre    10,000    15.00    150,000.00    3,191.49 USD
 Peas   1 acre    10,000    10.00    100,000.00    2,127.66 USD
 Corns   1 acre    15,000    10.00    150,000.00    3,191.49 USD 
 Profit    505,400.00    10,753.19 USD
 Net Profit  HTG 434,900.00  9,253.19  USD
REWARDS: 

For all of you that contribute less than 100 USD, i ll send you the book: How to win friends and  influence people. 

Twelve Things This Book Will Do For You

  1. Get you out of a mental rut, give you new thoughts, new visions, new ambitions.
  2. Enable you to make friends quickly and easily.
  3. Increase your popularity.
  4. Help you to win people to your way of thinking.
  5. Increase your influence, your prestige, your ability to get things done.
  6. Enable you to win new clients, new customers.
  7. Increase your earning power.
  8. Make you a better salesman, a better executive.
  9. Help you to handle complaints, avoid arguments, keep your human contacts smooth and pleasant.
  10. Make you a better speaker, a more entertaining conversationalist.
  11. Make the principles of psychology easy for you to apply in your daily contacts.
  12. Help you to arouse enthusiasm among your associates.
If you give between 500 to  1,000 USD, I ll send you two books: How to win friends and  influence people, Think and Grow rich. Updates of the project, and a surprise. 

If you give more than  1,000 USD, I ll send you two books: How to win friends and  influence people, Think and Grow rich. Updates of the project, a surprise, and your money back in two years with 5% of interest rate a year.

 For all of you that contribute less than 100 USD, i ll send you the book: How to win friends and  influence people. 

Twelve Things This Book Will Do For You

Get you out of a mental rut, give you new thoughts, new visions, new ambitions.
Enable you to make friends quickly and easily.
Increase your popularity.
Help you to win people to your way of thinking.
Increase your influence, your prestige, your ability to get things done.

If you give between 500 to  1,000 USD, I ll send you two books: How to win friends and  influence people, Think and Grow rich. Updates of the project, and a surprise. If you give more than  1,000 USD, I ll send you two books: How to win friends and  influence people, Think and Grow rich. Updates of the project, a surprise, and your money back in two years with 5% of interest rate a year.

story:
We are a small local yarn shop in the heart of the Kawartha Lakes, we've been open since December 2012, and it's time to grow our shop, we've been presented with an opportunity to expand our shop in our current location, and well, and we are almost ready to take the plunge.  That's where our campaign starts.  

We believe that knitting, like most fiber arts is a community driven industry, to us, being active in our community, and being a host for community events is important to our knitters and crocheters, but to the community as a whole.  

This campaign will help us grow our shop.  growing our shop means more extra help can be provided for knitters and crochters alike, where the open door policy is nurtured and encouraged.  We can help better our knitting and crocheting community, by providing a larger class room, to teach, and to accommodate community events, like the 4H knitting club, as well as nurture a community of people who are consistently giving back to our small town community as a whole.

As a contributor, you'd be providing us with the funds, to make a fabulous learning annex, and providing class seats for women from the local women's shelter, to learn a marketable skill, to help re enter the work place.  It also provides, a fabulous environment for friendships, and a support network to be created through art.


Aberdeen's Wool Co. started with about 300 square feet, and we've made the most of our space.  However, we have in the last 2 years far exceeded our footprint.  Our community has grown, and we would love to be able to foster our community's needs, and pay it forward.  We've been offered the opportunity to expand our space, in our established location, but we need your help.  With expansion, of course comes additional costs.  
We require a larger classroom, tables, chairs, visual aids, additional staff, and teaching supplies.  Approx. $3000 of our goal.
We also have some construction costs, building new shelving, paint, labour costs, and a new air conditioning unit for the larger space, to be able to operate larger classes, during the summer months (knitting and high humidity, aren't exactly best friends).  Approx. $3000 of our goal.
The additional $2500 of our goal, is for an updated POS system, and our continued involvement in community organizations.
The larger classroom, will allow to generate additional revenue, in order to continue our work with local organizations, like the local 4-H knitting club, (I've included an article from the local newspaper, because these girls are amazing).  We will also be able to provide 4 individuals from the local women's shelter a free class seat and supplies each year, to help them develop a marketable skill, to help with reentry to the work place.  
http://www.mykawartha.com/news-story/5531710-victoria-park-yarn-bombed-by-4-h-kawartha-lakes-haliburton-knitting-club/
If we are unable to reach our entire goal, we will have to scale back on some of the construction, however, our focus will remain on our community involvement, as well as the class room.
By contributing, knitter or not a knitter, the perks are pretty cool.

We completely understand if you aren't able to contribute, but if you wouldn't mind giving us a share or referral we'd greatly appreciate it.

story:
We are a group of young Scottish entrepreneurs who love two things: technology and whisky. But it wasn't always like this. We graduated from university a few years ago and as our lifestyles improved, we became tired of drinking low quality, cheap beverages. Drinking alcohol became less about quantity and more about quality and so it was time to upgrade our drink of choice. Being Scottish and huge fans of Mad Men, whisky was the natural solution. Yet, like most people we felt a little overwhelmed by choice, undereducated in taste and discouraged by price. So much so that the thought of purchasing enough whisky to discover what we liked didn’t appeal. So, YoCo Club was born.


YoCo Club is the monthly whisky subscription service delivering a case of two single malt Scotch whiskies with accompanying tasting notes and a membership card for as little as £27 per month. We have selected a range of whiskies from each of Scotland's whisky regions and will be sending subscribers a monthly case containing 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky. One for you and one to share. In other words, each case contains 40cl of whisky, which is over 12 drams for you to collect and enjoy every month. 

We have included some of Scotland’s most popular distilleries, such as Talisker and Glenlivet, as well as hidden gems like Inchgower and Kilchoman. This ensures you get to taste and experience the best of Scottish whisky: from the bottles that everyone raves about, to the undiscovered drams that you would struggle to find in a bar. Rest assured, every whisky you receive from our great range will be a premium single malt Scotch whisky…without compromise!

You can subscribe for either 1 month, 3 months, 6 months or 12 months and your first case will also contain a membership card that will give you exclusive access to some of the UK's finest venues. This will allow you to build on your knowledge and learn to appreciate the complex tastes of each whisky. In addition to the selected whiskies, each recurring monthly case will contain an invitation for a friend to join the club and tasting notes about the current month's whiskies, accessible by following the link on your membership card.

Joining the club will allow you to sample some of the world’s best whisky whilst you discover what you like and what you don’t like without racking up an expensive bar bill. It's really easy to join, just pick one of our rewards and become a founding member! 


YoCo Club is more than a whisky club. YoCo is an abbreviation of “Young Company” and we are on a mission to become this generation’s answer to discovering, delivering and revelling in Scotch whisky. We are a lifestyle club that escapes the old school image of a whisky club. Whether you enjoy drinking whisky with ice, water, one sip at a time or all in one go, we don’t mind and we won’t hold you to "traditional etiquette". We're here to deliver great whisky directly to your door. 

It's now time to introduce the Indiegogo community to YoCo Club and share some of the world's best whisky with you. But don't just take our word for it. World leading whisky expert Charles MacLean has joined our team of Ambassadors and given his seal of approval: 


  1. Select a membership. We offer 4 different memberships from 1 month to 12 months, so make sure to pick the reward that adequately quenches your thirst.
  2. Every calendar month we will pick, pack and send your order giving you a full 30 days to enjoy the exquisite flavours packed inside each case. 
  3. Every case contains two single malt Scotch whiskies with accompanying tasting notes, a membership card and an invitation for a friend to join the Club. Make sure to share on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram as after all, enjoying whisky makes for a better experience when shared in the company of others. 
So there you have it: a case of 2 single malt Scotch whiskies delivered to your door, every month. With over 60 whiskies on board we are quite literally opening the doors to Scotland’s finest distilleries, offering you the best opportunity to delve into the exciting world of whisky.

The Taster's Case (1 Month - £15)

With this reward your case will include 3x5cl bottles of different single malt whiskies with accompanying tasting notes and your exclusive YoCo Club membership card. This is the perfect way to dip your toe in the "water of life" as you will get to experience 3 single malts from across Scotland. DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Explorer's Case (1 Month - £30)

This case is for the inquisitive drinker. You will receive 3 different single malts to taste and enjoy from the Highlands, Islands and Speyside. Your case will include 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky, 1x5cl bottle of our second chosen whisky and 1x5cl bottle of our third chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and your exclusive YoCo Club membership card. DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Explorer's Gift (1 Month Gift - £30)

Do you know someone who would appreciate a membership? With this reward you can gift a case to someone of your choice (1 month membership that includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky, 1x5cl bottle of our second chosen whisky and 1x5cl bottle of our third chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and an exclusive YoCo Club membership card). After all, it won't be long until YoCo Club becomes 'invite only'. DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

Uncorking YoCo Club (1 Month - £30)

You will receive one of the first cases...bragging rights included. Your case will include 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and your exclusive YoCo Club membership card. DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Gift of Whisky (1 Month Gift - £30)

Do you know someone who would appreciate a membership? With this reward you can gift a case to someone of your choice (1 month membership that includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and an exclusive YoCo Club membership card). After all, it won't be long until YoCo Club becomes 'invite only'. DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Quarter Cask (3 Months - £87) 

With this reward you will receive a 3 month subscription to YoCo Club (3 cases). Each monthly case includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and your exclusive YoCo Club membership card. It's the perfect introduction to the club for those who want to dabble in the world of whisky without a long-term commitment. YOUR FIRST CASE DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Gift of Whisky (3 Months - £87)

Do you know someone who is a fan of whisky? With this reward you can gift a 3 month membership to someone of your choice (3 monthly cases, each case includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and an exclusive YoCo Club membership card). After all, it won't be long until YoCo Club becomes 'invite only'. THE FIRST CASE DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

Simply A Half (6 Months - £168)

With this reward you will receive a 6 month subscription to YoCo Club (6 cases). Each monthly case includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and your exclusive YoCo Club membership card. This reward is the perfect way to give you an in-depth knowledge of fine Scotch whisky, whilst ensuring you are not over committing. YOUR FIRST CASE DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

The Gift of Whisky (6 Months - £168)

Do you know someone who loves their whisky? With this reward you can gift a 6 month membership to someone of your choice (6 monthly cases, each case includes 1x20cl bottle of our first chosen whisky and 4x5cl bottles of our second chosen whisky with accompanying tasting notes and an exclusive YoCo Club membership card). After all, it won't be long until YoCo Club becomes 'invite only'. THE FIRST CASE DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

VIP Club Member (£500)

With this reward you will become a VIP member of YoCo Club and receive a 12 month subscription. VIP membership entitles you to two complimentary ticket to all YoCo Club events including the Official Launch Party, which will be held in a prestigious and secret location in Scotland in 2016. YOUR FIRST CASE DELIVERED IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS - FREE SHIPPING (UK ONLY).

An Old Friend (£1,250)

The craftsmanship, skill, care and diligence put into the process of making single malt Scotch whisky at Scottish distilleries is admired globally. This reward entitles you to an executive level tour of a distillery where you'll learn about one of the finest single malts in the world and take part in a private tasting to ensure you're fully clued up on the malt's wonderful history and flavours! This reward also includes a 12 month VIP YoCo Club membership, UK travel and 1 night's accommodation.

A Day of Decadence (£2,500)

Enjoying the taste of single malt Scotch whisky is great, but experiencing what Scotland has to offer with a dram in your hand is unbeatable. With this reward you will play a round of golf at a famous Scottish golf course, stay at a 5 star resort and crack open a bottle of Scotch at the bar. You will also become a 12 month VIP YoCo Club member. 

A Lord in Residence (£5,000)

This is the pinnacle of YoCo Club. There can only be one Lord and this reward offers you the chance to take residency. With this reward you will become an official Lord (if you are not one already) and the face of our 2016 campaign. You will also become a 12 month VIP YoCo Club member and are cordially invited to join our Founders event, which will include a round of golf at a famous Scottish golf course plus travel and accommodation. 


We are looking to raise £10,000 to get us jump-started. We need the funds to pay for initial tooling & set up manufacturing costs, purchase stock, secure further contracts with distilleries across Scotland and cover start up costs associated with running a technology company.

You can absolutely help us achieve our goal by donating whatever you are comfortable with. We are desperate to unlock the potential of Scotch whisky for people around the world so that they can part-take in new experiences and flavours. Every penny towards the campaign will take us one step closer to reaching this aspiration so please back us today and receive one of the very first YoCo Club cases.

Oh and make sure to join us for a dram if you ever find yourself in Glasgow!


  • How long before I receive my first case? We are aiming to dispatch all orders within the first week of December so you should receive your order during mid to late December. We are aware that Christmas happens on the 25th of December (we will double check to be sure) so will make every effort to get your case to you prior to the 25th. 
  • Where do you deliver to? We currently only ship within the UK. This is due to international restrictions imposed on alcohol. We are aiming to expand rapidly and should be in your country soon. Please send us an email to hello@yococlub.com and let us know if you would like to see YoCo Club in your country.
  • I entered my address incorrectly. Can I change it? Please email hello@yococlub.com with subject title: ‘Address Change’ and we will mail your box to your corrected address. 
  • Where are you located? We are based in Glasgow. If you would like to send us anything in the mail, please send to the following address: YoCo Club, 1st Floor, 16 Gordon Street, Glasgow, G1 3PT.


Please ensure you've read the FAQ before contacting us!

Backers: indiegogo@yococlub.com

Business Enquiries: business@yococlub.com

Press Enquiries: press@yococlub.com

Thanks for checking out YoCo Club. Don't be shy to share with your friends. 

Calum (@calumleslie) and Fraser (@fd_sutherland).


  • We‘re almost ready to ship, Indiegogo funds will cover our initial stock purchase and allow us to put the finishing touches on our website (due to launch in December 2015). Your contribution guarantees you one of the first, exclusive YoCo Club cases despatched anywhere in the world.

  • You must be of legal drinking age at the time of purchase in the UK (we do not sell internationally...yet).

  • Please note that your travel and accommodation are your own responsibility (unless specified as part of the perk).
  • You must provide sufficient notice for any visits relating to perks. Sufficient notice being no less than 6 months. Visits will be subject to availability and must be agreed with the provider.
  • The provider reserves the right to revoke perks.
  • In the event of unforeseen circumstances, the provider is under no obligation to continue perk fulfilment.
  • Perks must be claimed within 2 years from the date of purchase.

Every penny towards the campaign will take us one step closer to reaching this aspiration so please back us today and receive one of the very first YoCo Club cases.
Oh and make sure to join us for a dram if you ever find yourself in Glasgow!



How long
     before I receive my first case? We are
     aiming to dispatch all orders within the first week of December so you
     should receive your order during mid to late December. We are aware that
     Christmas happens on the 25th of December (we will double check to be
     sure) so will make every effort to get your case to you prior to the
     25th. 
Where do
     you deliver to? We currently only ship within the UK. This is due to international restrictions imposed on alcohol. We are aiming to expand rapidly and should be in your country soon. Please send us an email to hello@yococlub.com and let us know if you would like to see YoCo Club in your country.
I entered
     my address incorrectly. Can I change it? Please
     email hello@yococlub.com with subject title: ‘Address Change’ and we will
     mail your box to your corrected address. 
Where are
     you located? We are based in Glasgow. If you would like to
     send us anything in the mail, please send to the following
     address: YoCo Club, 1st Floor, 16
     Gordon Street, Glasgow, G1 3PT.



Please ensure you've
read the FAQ before contacting us!
Backers: indiegogo@yococlub.com
Business
Enquiries: business@yococlub.com
Press
Enquiries: press@yococlub.com
Thanks for checking
out YoCo Club. Don't be shy to share with your friends. 
Calum (@calumleslie) and Fraser (@fd_sutherland).









We‘re almost ready to ship, Indiegogo funds will cover our initial stock purchase and allow us to put the finishing touches on our website (due to launch in December 2015). Your contribution guarantees you one of the first, exclusive YoCo Club cases despatched anywhere in the world.
You must be of legal drinking age at the time of purchase in the UK (we do not sell internationally...yet).

Please note that your travel and accommodation are your own responsibility (unless specified as part of the perk).
You must provide sufficient notice for any visits relating to perks. Sufficient notice being no less than 6 months. Visits will be subject to availability and must be agreed with the provider.
The provider reserves the right to revoke perks.
In the event of unforeseen circumstances, the provider is under no obligation to continue perk fulfilment.
Perks must be claimed within 2 years from the date of purchase.

story:
Our Story

GROW (Gaining Resilience and Opportunities for Women and youth) is a Tanzanian-based project that builds on the collective potential of rural women. Deep in the lush green mountains of northwestern Tanzania lies the vibrant region of Ngara brimming with potential in the rich farmland of the local communities. Ngara is one of the poorest and most remote regions in Tanzania. The annual household income is less than $95. The idea for GROW was born from the need for economic growth in Ngara’s local sector and the recognition of the vast potential of women and youth. The project was developed by WomenCraft, a well-established social enterprise that has operated in Ngara for six years. The GROW team strives to tap into the vast potential of the diverse natural wealth of the region as a means to develop rural-income generating activities. We have developed a collection of sustainable micro-entrepreneurship activities, including rice farms, sunflower farms, and beekeeping, with the vision of expanding the economic sector, while simultaneously improving access to nutrition and empowering local women. 


                           


Our Objectives

- To mobilize women and youth and introduce new, sustainable livelihood opportunities

- To increase financial literacy of women and youth through technical assistance and entrepreneurship training

- To facilitate women and youth to work together in groups through leadership training and capacity building

- To provide continued support and project monitoring so that groups and individuals are able to launch and grow their profit-making ventures


                 


Our Campaign Goal

Our primary focus for this fundraiser lies in the beekeeping project, which holds vast potential to flourish into a profitable business of producing honey and beeswax products. Currently GROW has 8 beekeeper groups with a total of 65 members. We believe in investing in a small, focused project from which the profits will be reinvested to help the expansion of the businesses and the inclusion of more group members. Our next harvest season is quickly approaching in September and we are in need of your help to ensure our first harvest is successful so we can secure the future of GROW. We are seeking to raise $5,000 to supply the necessary equipment and training to harvest this season’s first round of honey and beeswax. 


                 


How Can You Help?  

The success of our beekeeping project works as a domino effect. We plan to start out small by concentrating on making our first harvest a success. With your help, we can focus on the empowerment of our 65 beekeepers and enable the first round of successful honey and beeswax processing to run smoothly. 

Your donations fund:

-  Protective gear and equipment, such as boots, masks, and buckets for the harvesting, processing, and packaging procedures

- Training for our beekeepers to ensure high quality production of honey and beeswax

- A clean, secure processing and storage room for honey and beeswax

- Basic packaging (jars, labels) 

 Equipped with a few simple tools, our trained beekeepers can successfully harvest the first season of honey and perfect the art of honey-making and purifying beeswax. The production and sale of profitable goods allows our apiaries to increase in number, thus expanding the potential for products produced and increasing the number of local community members who financially benefit from participation in GROW’s beekeeping enterprise. 

Other ways to help? We also appreciate help in spreading the conversation about GROW’s mission and products to family and friends and via social media platforms and word-of-mouth. 

-Please specify that donations are being made out to GROW/beekeeping.-


                                         


Future Goals and Projected Impact

- Expand rural income-generating activities, business skills, and financial knowledge of the local community
-Increase the economic potential of the women and their families involved with GROW
-Tackle gender inequality through economic empowerment, knowledge and skills workshops, and education 

We aim to tackle gender inequality and poverty through the production of goods that can be enjoyed on a global scale and that connect communities worldwide. The GROW team envisions a thriving micro-enterprise business that produces, markets, and sells quality honey, beeswax candles, and other products in the local Tanzanian and international markets. Eventually, we hope that GROW flourishes into a self-sustainable enterprise that gives back to the local economy and that is run by local women whom have risen as community leaders through the GROW training. 

                        


Contact

For further information or questions contact us at: 
grow@womencraft.org
www.womencraft.org
www.facebook.com/womencraft

story:
What is Living Room?

Living Room is an endeavor to build community through the love of music: connecting people with the music and musicians that they love and providing a place for Tulsans to connect with one another.

In 2013, after graduating college, we noticed that it was difficult to connect with people. We figured we couldn’t be the only ones that felt this way. How could we bring together community on a larger scale? What started with having friends over for dinner, and late nights listening to friends write songs grew into a solution. Living rooms are an important part of family life. From your living room, you can catch up on the world, or with some friends, you can be entertained or can find rest. Regardless of what you choose to do, you’re doing it with the people you care about. 

Unlike your living room, is the modern concert space. While we all love a good rock show, nobody likes to feel like cattle herded in and out of a space by barking security guards. Living Room is a place where artists from around the country come and play music. Instead of being behind a barricade and up on a tall stage, you get to meet them, and nobody will tackle you to the ground for that. At Living Room You’re not livestock, you’re a human and we appreciate your support and contribution. 

Here are the Logistics

It can be difficult to make a sufficient living as a musician. In establishing Living Room we see artist compensation as our top priority. Artists pour a large amount of time, energy and money into their craft. They deserve not only to be heard, but compensated for their efforts.

You can’t put on a show without sound equipment. Currently, we are supported by our friends that allow us to use their audio equipment for our events. As we host larger and more notable artists and bands, and as we look to moving into our own space, the equipment needs to be able to properly capture musicians as they want to be heard.  

What’s a living room without the décor? Living Room needs to feel like… well, a living room, preferably one that’s a step above a recent college graduate’s. It’s going to require a keen eye, some lights, and some decorations. But while we’re at it, we will go ahead and mention, food sales (because who doesn’t eat in their living room?) and marketing (because we got to tell you about what’s coming up next). In the future, we would love to supply a space for local vendors to sell their food.

You can’t have a living room without a home to put it in. As of now, our friends at HootOwl Coffee have graciously allowed us to use their retro coffee shop. Living Room would not be possible without their help and support. Our loftiest and current long term goal is acquisition, either by way of renting or owning, of a show and community Living Room space. 

We need your contributions to begin all of these processes. 

The Future of Living Room

There are endless possibilities and we can’t wait to see what’s in store. Living Room wants to forever keep community building and the arts as it’s primary focus.

Long term, we would love to work with local businesses, offering them advertisement space at our live events at a reasonable price or allowing their merchandise at our shows. The Living Room would love to host more than just music events. It could easily be a place that supports all of the visual arts from painting to theater. In addition to the arts, we would love to have a part in community development and outreach.

We would like to empower others to plant living room space in other parts of the country. We’re excited to see what Living Room looks like in different cities and to see how people utilize it to benefit their community. 

Risks & Challenges

We genuinely believe in the vision for Living Room. Most of our development consists of hard work by trial and error. We continually come up with new ideas to develop our business and the community it serves. There are always startup costs and financial hurtles that come with establishing a business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are not the only way to support Living Room. If you are unable to donate, here are a few means by which to contribute: attend a show, share about Living Room with your friends, or follow and engage with us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. Your presence, whether on social media or at an actual event, is priceless to us. 

There are thousands of artist all around the country, and we want to provide a space for them to share their music. Feel free to refer artists to us so that they can play a show. We are also open to any suggestions or comments (good or bad) that you have that will enable us to grow.

story:
SOUTH AFRICA is a beautiful country and a popular holiday destination. It is where you will find one of the 7 Wonders of the World: TABLE MOUNTAIN.

SOUTH AFRICA also boasts the largest economy in AFRICA with a population of 60 Million people. Many call it the Rainbow Nation, The Cradle of Human Kind, Home to Nelson Mandela and the BREAD BASKET of Africa. Over the years, MANY FOREIGNERS have seeked a better living in South Africa and made their home here.

                 BUT WHAT IF THE BREADBASKET RUNS OUT OF BREAD?

Currently, beautiful SOUTH AFRICA is facing a huge problem: 30% of our population is UNEMPLOYED! The situation affects millions, especially CHILDREN.

           


This means that 18 Million people are JOBLESS, creating all sorts of problems like Xenophobia, criminal activities and poverty. These problems affects the world at large.



Throughout the years, THE PEPLER GROUP have already created 9000 SUSTAINABLE jobs in South Africa, using our own funds (more than 10 000 000 USD), by establishing 6 very successful projects and won many awards in doing so... (read more about them here: www.cowsharing.co.za )

BUT, we have not created nearly enough jobs to make a real impact on SOUTH AFRICA'S unemployment problem! 
We need to make a LASTING IMPACT on this volatile problem facing our country and continent. We had ENOUGH of this problem and it's crippling effects on society..

OUR AIM: To create jobs FASTER, bringing relief to a sea of unemployed people. The situation is VERY URGENT.

OUR PLAN: To make a BIG IMMEDIATE IMPACT and we CANNOT DO IT without HELP.

This is exactly WHY we turned to CROWD funding.

We believe that with YOUR HELP we can  bring about a permanent, lasting change in Africa, starting with South Africa.

         EVERY JOB that is created, IMPACT positively on at least THREE KIDS!


                                 

COW SHARING is our social OUTREACH & community UPLIFTMENT Project.(Website: www.cowsharing.co.za)

Cow SHARING is an innovative way to create JOBS in South Africa and help struggling farmers at the same time.

(See our testimonial videos below)

For the past 7 years, we have proven the concept to be sustainable over time. It is based on a MANAGED Pay Forward Model. It is also the ultimate Sustainable Green Economy builder.

So how do we implement and manage COW SHARING?

Please view our MAIN VIDEO for more information on Cow SHARING or go to our website: www.cowsharing.co.za

You may also e-mail us at: info @ cowsharing.co.za

OR call us directly on +27 83 309 3157

Please view these TESTIMONIALS to witness first hand how COW SHARING has been changing lives:




_____________________________________________________________________________

YOU can help someone in SOUTH AFRICA get a job TODAY and leave your legacy!

                                                             HOW ?

Yes, through COW FUNDING. We DARE YOU to match OUR OWN contributions made towards JOB CREATION in South Africa, to the value of 10 MIL USD. In doing so we will, together, create and sustain 80 000 NEW jobs!  Let us reach out to others through our Social Outreach Program.

You contribute, we purchase & manage the cattle that is placed with South African farmers on your behalf, this in return CREATES SUSTAINABLE JOBS.

Your cattle are not given to farmers which makes the model so unique, it is borrowed to the farmer for a specific period. This allows the project to continue indefinitely. PAYING FORWARD OVER AND OVER AGAIN

The farmer then shares in the proginy and builds his own herd as result over time.

Once the farmer has sufficient cattle of his own and created a number of sustainable jobs, the borrowed cattle are moved along to another farmer and the process repeats itself, creating a manageable, sustainable PAY FORWARD concept. This unique model is called COW SHARING. 

The Farmer who has been assisted now also makes a commitment to help at least 1 other farmer. It doubles the effort and the result. This way WE ENSURE the funds that you contribute continues to contribute for many years afterwards. 

                                     

                                             

                                         

                                          

                                            

   **************************************************************************                                 


****************************************************************************


1.  Who is the “PEPLER GROUP” ?

ANSWER:

We are a family business that has been in operation for the past 20 years in South Africa and we have created and sustained nearly 9000 JOBS. 

* See our Track Record for our Achievements and Awards on the Gallery page



1.  How do I claim my perks ?                                  



ANSWER:

Your basic perks will be emailed to you as soon as we recieve your contribution and your details.


ANSWER:

All the perks will be available throughout no perks will be sold out EVER !!


****************************************************************************

story:
Greek cafe in Armenia as a gift for my husband's 33rd birthday!

My story is straightforward. My husband moved from Greece to Armenia 5 years ago and since then he has been dreaming about opening a small open-air Greek café – a traditional rakomeladiko mixed with kafenio – a drinking and relaxation place, the type we used to go in Athens during our dating period. I love his idea!

My husband has found a cool green place in the center of the city, in a park, next to a small artificial lake. He has great ideas and a lot of passion but is short of cash to finalize the project.

In 10 days it is his birthday and the only gift worth giving I came up with – is to try to fund-raise as much as possible to make his dream come true.

I'm appealing to all the Greeks who live outside of Greece or those in Greece who want to see the traditions going. I'm also appealing to those who have some Greekness inside them, who appreciate good drinks with great snacks and pies, good company and relaxing outdoors, in a simple but great environment. Those who love summer, who love sun, who love blue and white colors :)

The money will be used to do some minor renovation (to take down crappy writings and posters), to paint the place in appropriate colors and decorate it with flowers. And of course, to bring some essential drinks from Greece as well as chairs and tables from Athens.

Please pitch in from $ 1 to $ 10 or just pass the information along, whatever you feel comfortable with! We will drink to your health as soon as we manage to open the café, and if you ever travel to Yerevan, Armenia - the drinks are on us!

You will be always welcome in our little Greek corner.
story_txt:
Greek cafe in Armenia as a gift for my husband's 33rd birthday!



My story is straightforward. My husband moved from Greece to Armenia 5 years ago and since then he has been dreaming about opening a small open-air Greek café – a traditional rakomeladiko mixed with kafenio – a drinking and relaxation place, the type we used to go in Athens during our dating period. I love his idea!
My husband has found a cool green place in the center of the city, in a park, next to a small artificial lake. He has great ideas and a lot of passion but is short of cash to finalize the project. 
In 10 days it is his birthday and the only gift worth giving I came up with – is to try to fund-raise as much as possible to make his dream come true. 
I'm appealing to all the Greeks who live outside of Greece or those in Greece who want to see the traditions going. I'm also appealing to those who have some Greekness inside them, who appreciate good drinks with great snacks and pies, good company and relaxing outdoors, in a simple but great environment. Those who love summer, who love sun, who love blue and white colors :)
The money will be used to do some minor renovation (to take down crappy writings and posters), to paint the place in appropriate colors and decorate it with flowers. And of course, to bring some essential drinks from Greece as well as chairs and tables from Athens. 
Please pitch in from $ 1 to $ 10 or just pass the information along, whatever you feel comfortable with! We will drink to your health as soon as we manage to open the café, and if you ever travel to Yerevan, Armenia - the drinks are on us! 
You will be always welcome in our little Greek corner.

story:
Hello, my name is Anthony...

After 15 enjoyable years as in IT consultant working for a dozen or more blue-chip companies I took a leap of faith to take my own ideas to market. My mission: to innovate ways to enrich local economies and communities throughout the UK.

In 2014, I launched Local Puzzle and in the first 18 months it drove over £500,000 revenue to local independent businesses, raised £4,000 for local schools and charities and 241 players won a combined total of £40,000 just by shopping local, playing puzzles and socialising with their friends.

Some players who have learned Local Puzzle through and through claim to win / earn more money from playing Local Puzzle than they do from their day jobs. We think this is a little exaggerated, but none the less, our vision is to make this very true for the top 20% of our players.


How It Works

It's simple, just shop with any of your local independent businesses (it doesn't even need to be listed on our site) then send us a photo of your receipt via email here here we'll then award you Puzzle Points. Those with the most Puzzle Points share thousands of pounds in cash every two months. That's it.

Every 6 months we give a donation to the school or charity with the more Puzzle Points you've scored, the bigger say you have in where that money goes.

Those who want to get more involved can top up their points by collecting Puzzle Codes, playing sliding puzzles, referring their friends, sponsoring their favourite businesses, trading in virtual shares and much more. There's a whole host of fun, the more you do, the more you'll win for yourself and your chosen school or charity (if you select one).

It's not luck, it's effort and cunning that will get you to the top.


Where Does The Money Come From?

Money comes into Local Puzzle from 3 revenue streams:

1) Contributions that the independent businesses choose to make in return for the extra customers they get;

2) Some of the players themselves choose to buy tickets to events, merchandise and other bits and pieces from us (they don't have too as Local Puzzle is free to play);

3) Other companies pay us fees to advertise their products and services to the independent businesses listed on the Local Puzzle Platform;


What We Need & What You Get


This will sound strange, but Local Puzzle grows by giving away more money to it's players, local schools and charities. This then draws more money into local businesses who are then are happy to contribute back to the prize funds, creating a spiral of economic growth for the entire local community.

Every £1 we give away currently generates £22 revenue for independent businesses.

On top of the extra money we'll give away, we need to recruit a small team to help grow the initiative (including making it easier to understand), it's been just me with a little help from friends and family so far, so I'm looking forward to creating some real jobs - which helps the local community even more.

We have lots of merchandise that you can purchase, from pens, torches and bags to limited edition digital Avatar's for the leader-board and tickets to amazing events we hold in the UK.

The Impact


Without any funding, our prize funds can currently support:

- about 150 players per month who take a share of £5,000 in cash winnings every two months
- £1,000 for local schools and charities every 6 months
- about £50,000 for local independent business per month.

With the funding required, in 6 months time, our prize funds will support:

- Over 500 players per month, with a total combined winnings of £20,000 every two months
- £6,000 for local schools and charities every 6 months
- £200,000 revenue for local independent businesses per month

These figures will continue to grow and with your help by way of contribution, will grow even more.


Risks & Challenges 


A risk is that we can't generate enough results for local independent businesses to justify enough contribution from them back into the scheme to sustain (and grow) the prize funds, this hasn't been a problem so far but it's up to all of us to create a buzz and demonstrate the community value, generosity and effectiveness of Local Puzzle.

Another risk is that it's all too complicated to understand or may seem to good to be true. This is a tough one, and whereas we make it more intuitive every day, until now we've let the results do the talking. Players find themselves winning easy prizes, which then motivates them to learn more about Local Puzzle and how to maximise there winnings. The businesses follow suit, they see more people spending in their shops and buzzing about Local Puzzle, this then gets their attention and we are then invited to explain more to them.

We go to extraordinary lengths to make sure the businesses only strengthens from being involved - the results are clear and transparent to them on their own Trade Dashboard and fundamentally, they have complete control without needing to lift a finger.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate us anything, don't worry, just spare some time to learn how to play Local Puzzle (it's free). You'll soon start winning some cash for your efforts and then you can choose to help fund us, or spend that money with a local independent business - in either case we all win.

story:
Short Summary

It's damn near summer time. You know what that means. Block party time. We're all sick of the cold and the rain and now that all of that is pretty much behind us, it's time to get together for some cold drinks and some hot beats. So, on the 4th of July, we hope that you'll be joining us on the south side of Woodbridge at the corner of Commonwealth and Selden for one of those old-fashioned, Detroit-style, block parties.

This will be our second annual. It is going to be extra special because we will be wishing a happy 50th to our good neighbor Clayton and bidding farewell to Chris Haag and Sophie George as they move to Utah to practice polygamy. We can party together all day, enjoy the neighborhood fireworks, and then get the late night set going with the DJ. Hope to see you there.

What We Need & What You Get

In the interest of transparency, it seems easiest to simply share our budget.  As you can see, this is not your uncle Al's back yard BBQ.  We will be getting permits from the city to block off some of the street to allow us to set up a small carnival of chaos.  

Obviously the big payout for everybody is a sweet party.  

ITEM TOTAL
BOUNCY HOUSE  $  318.00
MISC FOOD ETC  $  318.00
DJ  $  265.00
PARTY TENTS  $  265.00
BEER  $  212.00
DUNK TANK  $  185.50
PORTO POTTY WITH SINK  $  164.30
JOUST HOUSE  $  159.00
PORTO POTTY  $  121.90
KAROAKE  $  106.00
PERMITS  $  - 
TOTAL  $ 2,379.70

In The Event That We Do Not Raise The Full Amount

We realize that this is quite a bit of money, but we're hoping that everybody in the neighborhood can pitch in a little bit.  If only half of the houses in Woodbridge gave $20, we would easily make our goal.  If we don't get the full amount though, we will still have the party and purchase as much of what is on the above list as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute or not, we hope that you will attend.  At the very least, we would appreciate it if you could share this with your friends and family through email and social media.
