story:
DONATE AND MAKE IMPACT! 


“The European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificate is a ground breaking approach to increase the employability of young people and to help employers hire talent.” (Jan Mühlfeit, Chairman Europe, Microsoft Corporation 2007-2014)

We work in collaboration with the Portuguese Embassy in Switzerland and with the Swiss-Portuguese Chamber of Commerce to increase job opportunities!

Every 10 USD you donate pay for 1 hour of the eYe program for 1 young unemployed participant and brings them closer to a job!

If we raise 70,000$ we can give this chance to 30 unemployed youth, proving the concept of our program and get more investors to be able to scale up to other countries, like Italy, UK and Greece.

(Please see Portuguese translation at the end of the page)

If you had the opportunity to give someone hope, renewed self-confidence, a brighter future and a means of supporting themselves... all for a small donation... would you help? 


What is the problem?

Youth Unemployment is a massively complex issue and it is everybody’s problem.

60% of surveyed employers across Europe say that the young candidates they interview for jobs do not have the right soft skills and competencies. And while 7.5 million young people across Europe are out of a job, out of training or education, 2 million jobs are vacant and cannot be filled – limiting the growth of companies and creating instability for societies.

Nobody can solve the problem of Youth Unemployment – alone! The solution lies in collaboration!


How does the eYe certification program offer a solution?

The eYe certification program offers a radically new approach to solve the problem of Youth Unemployment. We have built an Impact Community of employers, organizations, academic institutions and individuals. We collaborate to:

1. Collect employers' hiring needs

2. Select young unemployed people

3. Provide 6 months of soft skills and competency training, coaching and an internship

4. Give employers access to young talent with the right skills

5. Connect eYe graduates with employment opportunities... which would otherwise be out of reach for the young unemployed

6. We ask eYe-graduates to remain part of the Impact Community and mentor the next cohort of young unemployed eYe participants




The eYe certification program is the bridge between the education system and the hiring companies.

eYe trains those soft skills and competencies (e.g. communication, problem solving, self-awareness, etc.) that employers are desperately looking for but that the education system does not provide. We give young unemployed the space to learn, to prepare for a job, to grow their levels of self-confidence, gain relevant work experience through an internship and build a strong community of like-minded. At the end of the 6-months program we connect our participants with job opportunities with employers in the eYe-Community.

This is not magic – it is simply the power of collaboration.

Can you imagine a youth - with no job, no options for a future - and you help open the door to a brighter tomorrow?


Who started the eYe certification program?

In 2014 CircularSociety started the eYe project.

CircularSociety is a Swiss-based enterprise, founded by Carsten Sudhoff (former Head of HR of the World Economic Forum). CircularSociety builds a Community where companies, organizations and individuals collaborate to solve the burning problems of our times. We apply a business approach to solve social issues and we harness the collaborative mindset of the 21st century generation to drive large scale sustainable business and social change. 

Instead of just talking about the problems in our society and passing on responsibility to someone else, we decided to create real solutions!


“The European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificate is a ground breaking approach to increase the employability of young people and to help employers hire talent.” (Jan Mühlfeit, Chairman Europe, Microsoft Corporation 2007-2014)


We upskill young unemployed people and help them find a job.

With your donation you can become part of this community and watch how your financial support will change the life of an unemployed person. Even a small donation to the eYe-program will help.

We work in collaboration with the Portuguese Embassy in Switzerland and with the Swiss-Portuguese Chamber of Commerce. 

We have the following organizational champions as our partners:


Our first cohort of 30 young unemployed people will start in Setúbal, Portugal end of September 2015 – and we need your help to secure the necessary funding!

The eYe-training curriculum has been designed, the trainers and coaches are booked, the location is prepared, the eYe-Community in Portugal and beyond is growing and hiring companies are waiting. All this has been made possible with the help of over 40 volunteers who have helped CircularSociety and through our personal funding.

We are ready to go! Your donation can ignite the fire!

Youth Employment is essential for a sustainable future in Europe – your decision to donate can spark many more people to do like you.

Our journey begins in Portugal. And If we get the necessary funding for this first cohort, we will be able to prove the feasibility of the eYe-Progam and scale up our project to more countries in Europe. 

Country by country, we are determined to help find jobs for 50,000 unemployed youth in Europe by 2018!


What We Need

Our goal is to raise 70’000 USD by 29th of September 2015, the start date of our first eYe cohort in the city of Setubal, Portugal.

The funds (net of Indiegogo fees and gifts) will be used to pay:

Training and Development (9 top trainers and coaches, 6 months English online course with unlimited hours, mentoring, career advice, etc.)

Accommodation (overnight during the 15 workshop days in Alambre, Portugal)

Food (breakfast, lunch and dinner during the 15 workshop days)

Networking events (with employers and executives)

for 30 participants during the eYe-training workshops.


Every 10 USD you donate will pay for 1 hour of the eYe program for 1 young unemployed participant and will bring them closer to a job!

STEP 1 to STEP 10 - 6 month eYe program:


Skills and competencies focused on during the eYe-progam

Learn more about the eYe program here: http://eye.circularsociety.com/

As a "Thank You"

... for your donation we have prepared some useful gifts. The gifts reflect what CircularSociety is about - community and social impact, collaboration and sustainability. 

We will list the name of each of our donors on the CircularSociety website. (If you want to stay anonymous please contact us here: info@circularsociety.com).


Donations less than 20 USD

Each contribution counts! Your name will appear on the wall of fame on our official CircularSociety website. 


20 USD

You get access to the recorded webinar “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel (see information about the live webinar - under donation of 50 USD). 


50 USD

Participate in the live online webinar (1.5 hours) “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel. Peter is Assistant Professor at the University of St. Gallen in Switzerland, entrepreneur, consultant, author of the book „Generation Jobless“  and an active member of the eYe certification program. We will discuss the specific challenges and opportunities arising at the intersection of the education system and the labor market. A short opening presentation about the topic in general will be followed by a discussion of the complexity of this multi-stakeholder issue. Participants will have a chance to ask their questions during the Q&A session.


100 USD

16GB "Top of the Line" USB stick (or similar) including the recorded webinar “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel (see information about the live webinar - under donation of 50 USD). 


250 USD

Meet with like-minded people: Participate in our social gathering and networking event in Zurich (Lorange Institute of Business) OR in Portugal (meet the graduating cohort in Setubal and enjoy Portuguese specialities).

- Food, drink and excellent networking is on us. Travel and accommodation expenses not covered (dates to be confirmed).


500 USD

“One-on-One” conversation with the founder of Circular Society, Carsten Sudhoff. This half an hour Skype call can be focused on leadership, sustainability or a topic of your choice.

Prior to founding CircularSociety, Carsten held the role of Chief HR Officer of the World Economic Forum (WEF). During that time he was also the Lead of the WEF’s Council on „New Models of Leadership“, bringing together some of the leading experts in the field of Leadership. For 12 years he worked at DaimlerChrysler in Logistics, Finance and HR. He has worked or lived in 8 countries on 3 continents.

Support the eYe Program and make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out!

  • Change you Facebook cover to our campaign image for the period of the campaign - Download image HERE
  • Share the link to our campaign on Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter - 
    http://igg.me/at/eye
  • Become part of our community: sign up for our newsletter and follow us on:

http://circularsociety.com/

https://www.facebook.com/EuropeanYouthEmployment

https://www.facebook.com/circularsociety

https://www.linkedin.com/company/circular-society

https://twitter.com/circularsociety
#eyecrowdfunding

PORTUGUESE TRANSLATION

De Doação para Impacto – Por cada 10 Euros doados, paga 1 hora de formação no programa eYe para 1 jovem desempregado e ajuda-o a estar mais perto de um emprego!

Qual é o problema?

O desemprego juvenil é um problema gravemente complexo e é um problema que nos afecta a todos.

60% dos empregadores entrevistados em toda a Europa diz que os jovens candidatos que entrevistam para empregos não têm as habilidades sociais e competências adequadas. E enquanto 7,5 milhões de jovens de toda a Europa estão sem emprego, sem formação ou educação , 2 milhões de empregos estão vagos - limitando o crescimento dos empregadores e criando instabilidade para a sociedade.

Ninguém consegue resolver o problema do desemprego jovem – sozinho! A solução está na colaboração!

Qual é a solução que a certificação eYe oferece?

O programa eYe oferece uma abordagem radicalmente nova para resolver o problema do desemprego jovem. Nós construímos uma comunidade de Impacto de empregadores, organizações, instituições académicas e indivíduos.

Colaboramos para:

- Recolha de necessidades de contratação dos empregadores

- Selecção de jovens desempregados

- Fornecer 6 meses formação de competências e habilidades sociais e um estágio

- Fornecer acesso ao emprego ... o que seria de outra forma estaria fora do alcance dos jovens desempregados.

- O programa de certificação eYe é a ponte entre o sistema de ensino e as empresas de contratação.

O eYe forma competências (por exemplo, comunicação, resolução de problemas, auto -conhecimento, etc. ) que os empregadores estão à procura desesperadamente, mas que o sistema de ensino não fornece. Damos aos jovens desempregados espaço para aprender, para se prepararem para um emprego, para aumentar os seus níveis de auto -confiança, ganharem experiência de trabalho relevante através de um estágio e construir uma forte comunidade com ideias semelhantes. No final do programa de 6 meses nós conectamos os nossos participantes com oportunidades de trabalho dentro da comunidade de impacto.

Isto não é magia – é o poder da colaboração!

Consegue imaginar a juventude – sem trabalho, sem opcções de futuro – e voce pode ajudar a abrir a porta para um amanhã melhor?


Quem é que começou o programa de certificação eYe?

Em 2014 a CircularSociety começou o projeto eYe.

A CircularSociety é uma empresa baseada na Suiça, fundada por Carsten Sudhoff (formador em HR do Word Economic Forum). A CircularSociety constroi uma Comunidade onde as empresas, organizações e individuos colaboram para resolver os problemas dos nossos dias. Nós aplicamos uma abordagem de negócio para resolver problemas de cariz social e aproveitar a mentalidade colaborativa da geração do século 21 para conduzir em grande escala empresarial sustentável e de mudança social.

Em vez de estarmos só a falar dos problemas que existem na nossa sociedade e de passar a responsabilidade para outro, nós decidimos criar verdadeiras soluções!

"O European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificado é uma abordagem inovadora para aumentar a empregabilidade dos jovens e para ajudar os empregadores contratar novos talentos . " (Jan Mühlfeit , Presidente Europa, Microsoft Corporation 2007-2014)

Nós desenvolvemos as competencias de jovens desempregados e vamos ajudá-los a encontrar um emprego.

Com o seu donativo, pode- se tornar parte desta comunidade e ver como o seu apoio financeiro vai mudar a vida de uma pessoa desempregada. Mesmo por mais pequena que seja a sua doação para o eYe.

Nós trabalhamos em colaboração com a Embaixada Portuguesa na Suíça e com a Câmara de Comércio Suíço -Português.

Temos os seguintes campeões organizacionais como nossos parceiros:

Nosso primeiro grupo de 30 jovens participantes irá começar em Setúbal, Portugal no final de setembro de 2015 - e precisamos de sua ajuda para garantir o financiamento necessário! O currículo de formação eYe foi projetado, os formadores e técnicos estão agendados, o local está preparado para a Comunidade eYe em Portugal e está a crescer cada vez mais. As empresas que procuram novos funcionários estão à nossa espera.

Estamos prontos para ir! O seu donativo pode acender a chama!

O Emprego Jovem é essencial para um futuro sustentável na Europa - a sua decisão de doar pode desencadear muitas mais pessoas a faze-lo. A nossa viagem começa em Portugal, se conseguirmos o financiamento necessário para este primeiro grupo, vamos ser capazes de provar a viabilidade do programa eYe e ampliar nosso projeto para mais países na Europa. País por país, estamos determinados a ajudar a encontrar empregos para 50 mil jovens desempregados na Europa até 2018!

O que precisamos?

O nosso objectivo é angariar 70.000 Euros até 29 de Setembro de 2015, data que marca o inicio da nossa primeira formação eYe em Setúbal, Portugal.

Os fundos (ver no Indiegogo taxas e presentes) irão pagar:

- Formação e Desenvolvimento (9 dos melhores formadores e tecnicos, 6 meses de um Curso Online de Inglês com horas ilimitadas, orientação e aconselhamento vocavional, etc.)

- Acomodação (estadia noturna durante 15 dias de workshop no Parque de Alambre, Portugal)

- Refeições (Pequeno almoço, almoço e jantar durante os 15 dias de workshop)

- Eventos de criação de contactos (com empregadores e executivos)

Para os 30 participantes durante a formação nos Workshops eYe. Por cada 10 Euros doados, paga 1 hora de formação no programa eYe para 1 jovem desempregado e ajuda-o a estar mais perto de um emprego!
story_txt:
DONATE AND MAKE IMPACT! 

“The European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificate is a ground breaking approach to increase the employability of young people and to help employers hire talent.” (Jan Mühlfeit, Chairman Europe, Microsoft Corporation 2007-2014)We work in collaboration with the Portuguese Embassy in Switzerland and with the Swiss-Portuguese Chamber of Commerce to increase job opportunities!Every 10 USD you donate pay for 1 hour of the eYe program for 1 young unemployed participant and brings them closer to a job!If we raise 70,000$ we can give this chance to 30 unemployed youth, proving the concept of our program and get more investors to be able to scale up to other countries, like Italy, UK and Greece.
(Please see Portuguese translation at the end of the page)If you had the opportunity to give someone hope, renewed self-confidence, a brighter future and a means of supporting themselves... all for a small donation... would you help? 
What is the problem?
Youth Unemployment is a massively complex issue and it is everybody’s problem.
60% of surveyed employers across Europe say that the young candidates they interview for jobs do not have the right soft skills and competencies. And while 7.5 million young people across Europe are out of a job, out of training or education, 2 million jobs are vacant and cannot be filled – limiting the growth of companies and creating instability for societies.

Nobody can solve the problem of Youth Unemployment – alone! The solution lies in collaboration!

How does the eYe certification program offer a solution?
The eYe certification program offers a radically new approach to solve the problem of Youth Unemployment. We have built an Impact Community of employers, organizations, academic institutions and individuals. We collaborate to:


1. Collect employers' hiring needs


2. Select young unemployed people


3. Provide 6 months of soft skills and competency training, coaching and an internship


4. Give employers access to young talent with the right skills


5. Connect eYe graduates with employment opportunities... which would otherwise be out of reach for the young unemployed


6. We ask eYe-graduates to remain part of the Impact Community and mentor the next cohort of young unemployed eYe participants








The eYe certification program is the bridge between the education system and the hiring companies.

eYe trains those soft skills and competencies (e.g. communication, problem solving, self-awareness, etc.) that employers are desperately looking for but that the education system does not provide. We give young unemployed the space to learn, to prepare for a job, to grow their levels of self-confidence, gain relevant work experience through an internship and build a strong community of like-minded. At the end of the 6-months program we connect our participants with job opportunities with employers in the eYe-Community.

This is not magic – it is simply the power of collaboration.

Can you imagine a youth - with
no job, no options for a future - and you help open the door to a
brighter tomorrow?

Who started the eYe certification
program?

In 2014 CircularSociety started the eYe project.
CircularSociety is a Swiss-based enterprise, founded by Carsten Sudhoff (former
Head of HR of the World Economic Forum). CircularSociety builds a Community
where companies, organizations and individuals collaborate to solve the burning
problems of our times. We apply a business approach to solve social issues
and we harness the collaborative mindset of the 21st century generation to
drive large scale sustainable business and social change. 
Instead of just talking about the problems in our society and passing on responsibility to someone else, we decided to create real solutions!

“The European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificate is a ground breaking
approach to increase the employability of young people and to help employers
hire talent.” (Jan Mühlfeit, Chairman Europe, Microsoft Corporation
2007-2014)



We upskill young unemployed people
and help them find a job.
With your donation you can become part of this community
and watch how your financial support will change the life of an unemployed
person. Even a small donation to the eYe-program will help.
We work in collaboration with the
Portuguese Embassy in Switzerland and with the Swiss-Portuguese Chamber of
Commerce. 
We have the following organizational champions as our partners:





Our first cohort of 30 young
unemployed people will start in Setúbal, Portugal end of September 2015 – and
we need your help to secure the necessary funding!

The eYe-training curriculum has been designed, the trainers and coaches are booked, the location is prepared, the eYe-Community in Portugal and beyond is growing and hiring companies are waiting. All this has been made possible with the help of over 40 volunteers who have helped CircularSociety and through our personal funding.
We are ready to go! Your donation can
ignite the fire!
Youth Employment is essential for a
sustainable future in Europe – your decision to donate can spark many more
people to do like you.
Our journey begins in Portugal. And
If we get the necessary funding for this first cohort, we will be able to prove
the feasibility of the eYe-Progam and scale up our project to more countries in
Europe. 
Country by country, we are determined to help find jobs for 50,000
unemployed youth in Europe by 2018!

What We Need

Our goal is to raise 70’000 USD by 29th of
September 2015, the start date of our first eYe cohort in the city of Setubal,
Portugal.
The funds (net of Indiegogo fees and gifts) will be used to pay:
Training and Development (9 top trainers and coaches, 6 months English online course with unlimited hours, mentoring, career advice, etc.)


Accommodation (overnight during the 15 workshop days in Alambre, Portugal)


Food (breakfast, lunch and dinner during the 15 workshop days)

Networking events (with employers and executives)


for 30 participants during the
eYe-training workshops.

Every 10 USD you donate will pay for
1 hour of the eYe program for 1 young unemployed participant and will bring
them closer to a job!
STEP 1 to STEP 10 - 6 month eYe
program:





Skills and competencies focused on
during the eYe-progam



Learn more about the eYe program
here: http://eye.circularsociety.com/


As a "Thank You" 


... for your donation we have
prepared some useful gifts. The gifts reflect what CircularSociety is about -
community and social impact, collaboration and sustainability. 

We will list the name of each of our donors on the CircularSociety website. (If
you want to stay anonymous please contact us here:
info@circularsociety.com).


Donations less than 20 USD


Each contribution counts! Your name
will appear on the wall of fame on our official CircularSociety website. 


20 USD


You get access to the recorded
webinar “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel
(see information about the live webinar - under donation of 50 USD). 



50 USD


Participate in the live online
webinar (1.5 hours) “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel.
Peter is Assistant Professor at the University of St. Gallen in Switzerland,
entrepreneur, consultant, author of the book „Generation Jobless“  and an
active member of the eYe certification program. We will discuss the
specific challenges and opportunities arising at the intersection of the
education system and the labor market. A short opening presentation about the
topic in general will be followed by a discussion of the complexity of this
multi-stakeholder issue. Participants will have a chance to ask their questions
during the Q&A session.




100 USD

16GB "Top of the Line" USB stick (or similar) including the recorded webinar “Youth Unemployment – a multi-stakeholder issue” with Dr. Peter Vogel (see information about the live webinar - under donation of 50 USD). 








250 USD


Meet with like-minded people:
Participate in our social gathering and networking event in Zurich (Lorange
Institute of Business) OR in Portugal (meet the graduating cohort in Setubal
and enjoy Portuguese specialities).
- Food, drink and excellent
networking is on us. Travel and accommodation expenses not covered (dates to be confirmed).









500 USD


“One-on-One” conversation with the
founder of Circular Society, Carsten Sudhoff. This half an hour Skype call can
be focused on leadership, sustainability or a topic of your choice.
Prior to founding CircularSociety,
Carsten held the role of Chief HR Officer of the World Economic Forum (WEF).
During that time he was also the Lead of the WEF’s Council on „New Models of
Leadership“, bringing together some of the leading experts in the field of
Leadership. For 12 years he worked at DaimlerChrysler in Logistics, Finance and
HR. He has worked or lived in 8 countries on 3 continents.


Support the eYe Program and make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out!

Change you Facebook cover to our
     campaign image for the period of the campaign - Download image HERE



Share the link to our campaign on
     Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter - 
http://igg.me/at/eye

Become part of our community: sign
     up for our newsletter and follow us on:

http://circularsociety.com/
https://www.facebook.com/EuropeanYouthEmployment
https://www.facebook.com/circularsociety
https://www.linkedin.com/company/circular-society
https://twitter.com/circularsociety#eyecrowdfunding
PORTUGUESE TRANSLATION
De Doação para Impacto – Por cada 10 Euros doados, paga 1 hora de formação no programa eYe para 1 jovem desempregado e ajuda-o a estar mais perto de um emprego!
Qual é o problema?
O desemprego juvenil é um problema gravemente complexo e é um problema que nos afecta a todos.
60% dos empregadores entrevistados em toda a Europa diz que os jovens candidatos que entrevistam para empregos não têm as habilidades sociais e competências adequadas. E enquanto 7,5 milhões de jovens de toda a Europa estão sem emprego, sem formação ou educação , 2 milhões de empregos estão vagos - limitando o crescimento dos empregadores e criando instabilidade para a sociedade.
Ninguém consegue resolver o problema do desemprego jovem – sozinho! A solução está na colaboração!
Qual é a solução que a certificação eYe oferece?
O programa eYe  oferece uma abordagem radicalmente nova para resolver o problema do desemprego jovem. Nós construímos uma comunidade de Impacto de empregadores, organizações, instituições académicas e indivíduos.
Colaboramos para:
- Recolha de necessidades de contratação dos empregadores
- Selecção de jovens desempregados
- Fornecer 6 meses formação de competências e habilidades sociais e um estágio
- Fornecer acesso ao emprego ... o que seria de outra forma estaria fora do alcance dos jovens desempregados.
- O programa de certificação eYe é a ponte entre o sistema de ensino e as empresas de contratação.
O eYe forma competências (por exemplo, comunicação, resolução de problemas, auto -conhecimento, etc. ) que os empregadores estão à procura desesperadamente, mas que o sistema de ensino não fornece. Damos aos jovens desempregados espaço para aprender, para se prepararem para um emprego, para aumentar os seus níveis de auto -confiança, ganharem experiência de trabalho relevante através de um estágio e construir uma forte comunidade com ideias semelhantes. No final do programa de 6 meses nós conectamos os nossos participantes com oportunidades de trabalho dentro da comunidade de impacto.
Isto não é magia – é o poder da colaboração!
Consegue imaginar a juventude – sem trabalho, sem opcções de futuro – e voce pode ajudar a abrir a porta para um amanhã melhor? 
Quem é que começou o programa de certificação eYe?
Em 2014 a CircularSociety começou o projeto eYe.
A CircularSociety  é uma empresa baseada na Suiça, fundada por Carsten Sudhoff (formador em HR do Word Economic Forum). A CircularSociety constroi uma Comunidade onde as empresas, organizações e individuos colaboram para resolver os problemas dos nossos dias. Nós aplicamos uma abordagem de negócio para resolver problemas de cariz social e aproveitar a mentalidade colaborativa da geração do século 21 para conduzir em grande escala empresarial sustentável e de mudança social.
Em vez de estarmos só a falar dos problemas que existem na nossa sociedade e de passar a responsabilidade para outro, nós decidimos criar verdadeiras soluções!
"O European Youth Employment (eYe) - Certificado é uma abordagem inovadora para aumentar a empregabilidade dos jovens e para ajudar os empregadores contratar novos talentos . " (Jan Mühlfeit , Presidente Europa, Microsoft Corporation 2007-2014)
Nós desenvolvemos as competencias de jovens desempregados e vamos ajudá-los a encontrar um emprego.
Com o seu donativo,  pode- se tornar parte desta comunidade e ver como o seu apoio financeiro vai mudar a vida de uma pessoa desempregada. Mesmo por mais pequena que seja a sua doação para o eYe.
Nós trabalhamos em colaboração com a Embaixada Portuguesa na Suíça e com a Câmara de Comércio Suíço -Português.
Temos os seguintes campeões organizacionais como nossos parceiros:
Nosso primeiro grupo de 30 jovens participantes irá começar em Setúbal, Portugal no final de setembro de 2015 - e precisamos de sua ajuda para garantir o financiamento necessário! O currículo de formação eYe foi projetado, os formadores e técnicos estão agendados, o local está preparado para a  Comunidade eYe em Portugal e está a crescer cada vez mais. As empresas que procuram novos funcionários estão à nossa espera.
Estamos prontos para ir! O seu donativo pode acender a chama!
O Emprego Jovem é essencial para um futuro sustentável na Europa - a sua decisão de doar pode desencadear muitas mais pessoas a faze-lo. A nossa viagem começa em Portugal, se conseguirmos o financiamento necessário para este primeiro grupo, vamos ser capazes de provar a viabilidade do programa eYe e ampliar nosso projeto para mais países na Europa. País por país, estamos determinados a ajudar a encontrar empregos para 50 mil jovens desempregados na Europa até 2018!
O que precisamos?
O nosso objectivo é angariar 70.000 Euros até 29 de Setembro de 2015, data que marca o inicio da nossa primeira formação eYe em Setúbal, Portugal.
Os fundos (ver no Indiegogo taxas e presentes) irão pagar:
- Formação e Desenvolvimento (9 dos melhores formadores e tecnicos, 6 meses de um Curso Online de Inglês com horas ilimitadas, orientação e aconselhamento vocavional, etc.)


- Acomodação (estadia noturna durante 15 dias de workshop no Parque de Alambre, Portugal)
- Refeições (Pequeno almoço, almoço e jantar durante os 15 dias de workshop)
- Eventos de criação de contactos (com empregadores e executivos)
Para os 30 participantes durante a formação nos Workshops eYe.
Por cada 10 Euros doados, paga 1 hora de formação no programa eYe para 1 jovem desempregado e ajuda-o a estar mais perto de um emprego!

story: I have years of experience in the travel and IT industries and have lived abroad for 10 years. I am compelled by travel, its importance to who we are and how we meet people and improve ourselves. It is this love of travel that allows me to choose products that I believe people will enjoy buying, whether it's a dog coat or a locally made item that helps the seller to improve their lives. We also are planning to sell travel related products like bags, travel gear and other things to make travel easier and fun. Your contributions will help us to: Buy a computer and color printer; Print t-shirts and travel clothing; Pay for the domain name and hosting; Buy inventory and store items. I will be using SCOyRE for free business advice here in NYC. We will also hire disabled employees in the future (my own disability has taught me to help those who could use a hand) and a portion of our sales will go to dog shelters. If we don't meet our crowdfunding goal we will use whatever funds we make to do things; but on a smaller scale! In return for your investment you will receive an HHudsonTrading dog coat or a "Himself" dog towel to pat your pet dry! Thank you from Hudson (the dog in the picture -- a Boxer mix from a Brooklyn shelter).

story:
Who We Are

   Pawsitive Care is a small, veteran owned, family business that was started by Ashley Rivera in 2015. Ashley and her husband Jim have 3 children, and allowing them an opportunity to learn, grow, and be an active part of caring for animals has helped shape Pawsitive Care into what it has become today. You can follow us on Facebook at https://m.facebook.com/pawsitivecaretx/

   Pawsitive Care is a member of NAPPS (National Association of Professional Pet Sitters) and IBPSA (International Boarding and Pet Services Association). They provide professional pet sitting, dog walking, in-home boarding, and dog fostering for the South Houston and northern Brazoria County areas. 

 

Why Do We Need To Grow?

   As the community around us grows so does the need for quality pet care. Unfortunately, the number of pets in need also follow this trend. The need for fostering dogs became apparent to Ashley while walking dogs in different neighborhoods. She would often find them lost or abandoned, taking them home to house them temporarily until an owner or an adopter was found.

   The number of dogs needing a temporary home greatly outnumbers the places available. Currently, Ashley and her family board dogs from their home located on 1 acre in Manvel, TX and are very limited in the number of dogs that they can care for. By adding a building to board dogs in individual rooms, they can continue to grow and help families in the community while helping dogs in the community find families.

 

What We Need

   Regular kennels are often overcrowded, loud, smelly, and just an overall stressful place to be if you're a dog!

    High stress levels can cause physical and emotional harm to dogs no matter where they are. Too often, dogs that board at a regular kennel facility can become fearful of other dogs or become ill from stress and low sanitation standards.

    For those needing to be adopted it can mean a world of difference! Most people don't give a second glance to the sad dog hiding in a corner, the one barking aggressively at the gate, or one who looks unwell. Give that same dog an enriching environment, social interaction, and training- you've got a whole different pup that everyone wants to add to their family!

The Dog Haven 

Giving dogs a sense of calm and security is the main focus for building each dog suite- being a home away from home.

    The entire project aims to have 20 individual, climate controlled rooms with 6 being used for foster dogs on a regular basis. Each room will have a dog door that leads to a personal outdoor run so they can go in or out as they please throughout the daytime.

    The project also includes 3 play yards for exercise, socialization, and one-on-one playtime. All play yards will be strongly supervised while in use.

 

Where Your Money Goes

 

What You Get

We have a variety of awesome perks to show our thanks to our supporters! 

The Impact

    It would take us several years to be able to complete this project on our own, but the pets who need help in our community don't have that long to wait! Many of our fosters come from shelters where they are literally rescued from being euthanized. So many of these dogs have such wonderful personalities and want nothing more than to be loved, and you can help give them that extra time to find it!

 

Challenges

    We understand that if the goal is not reached right away it will hinder the time to complete the project. All funds raised through this event will go directly toward the construction of this project. If we are unable to meet the goal during this campaign, we will build a smaller version of this project as the funds allow and continue expanding as we are able.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring! While donating and supporting us financially is greatly appreciated, another huge way to help us is by sharing this event with others -friends, family, co-workers, acquaintances, fellow animal lovers, etc.!

  • Send the link through a text or email
  • Add to your social media page
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools 

 

Thank you to everyone for your time, love, and support!

story:
Welcome to Dairyland Shrimp

Dairyland Shrimp LLC is a family-owned indoor shrimp farm that raises Pacific white shrimp where you would least expect it–in the middle of America’s Dairyland. We have the freshest shrimp you can find in Wisconsin! We guarantee fresh, healthy, responsibly-raised shrimp without antibiotics or added chemicals and hormones. Learn more about our shrimp farming process.

Dairyland’s shrimp are sold alive and fresh. No chemicals or colorings are necessary to enhance the product, and our shrimp is more flavorful than frozen shrimp from the grocery store. You can feel good about eating our product because it is locally and sustainably grown and does not destroy natural ecosystems like the shrimp found in grocery stores. We have a few tasty shrimp recipes for you to enjoy.


The truth about the shrimp you buy in the grocery store

Depletion of the world’s oceans has created the need for new, sustainable ways to produce seafood. This has been especially true in the case of shrimp. The world’s natural ecosystem is rapidly being destroyed and almost 95% of the shrimp we eat are now farm raised in open air ponds and imported from Southeast Asia and South America where loose environmental regulations and optimal climates allow for production all year round.

Viral diseases and challenges from the environmental community toward traditional shrimp farming have been making consumers more aware of shrimp farming’s many flaws like habitat destruction, effluents of contaminated waste water, and use of pesticides and hormones.


Now a new and sustainable way of shrimp farming has evolved that protects shrimp from disease and protects the environment from hazardous shrimp farming practices, creating the possibility that indoor shrimp farming could become the cleanest seafood industry in the world!


What is biofloc shrimp farming?

Biofloc shrimp farming facilitates a bacterial community where the bacteria accumulate in clumps called flocs, which break down nitrogenous wastes and turn them into high-protein feed for the shrimp. The flocs process nitrogenous wastes and the shrimp feed on the flocs; this symbiotic relationship stabilizes water quality and supports rapid shrimp growth.

Our process

At Dairyland Shrimp LLC we use a biofloc heterotrophic saltwater system with zero water exchange; we re-circulate our water and therefore do not generate waste water. Waste feed and solids are diverted to clarifying tanks, where the solids settle and clear water is re-circulated back to the grow out tank. The floc also acts as part of the shrimp’s diet throughout the grow out period and the shrimp grow very efficiently, feeding off both the feed and the heterotrophic floc.

Our new facility

We need your help to fund a sustainable indoor shrimp farming facility that will be completely independent from a power grid. This state of the art facility will implement solar power and geothermal heat. We want are building to be a model to other shrimp farmers to show them just how sustainable and ecofriendly seafood can be.    

Here is how geothermal heat works.


Learn more about shrimp you find at the grocery store.(Consumer Reports article summarized)


Americans love shrimp

Each of us eats, on average, almost 4 pounds per year, making shrimp more popular than tuna. Once considered a special-occasion treat, shrimp has become so ubiquitous that we now expect to find it on the menu whether we’re at a pricey restaurant or a fast-food joint.

In fact, Americans eat about three times more shrimp than we did 35 years ago. To satisfy our insatiable appetite, the U.S. has become a massive importer: About 94 percent of our shrimp supply comes from abroad, from countries such as India, Indonesia, and Thailand.

But our love affair with shrimp does have a downside. Most of the shrimp we import is “farmed”—grown in huge industrial tanks or shallow, man-made ponds that can stretch for acres. In some cases 150 shrimp can occupy a single square meter (roughly the size of a 60-inch flat-screen television) where they’re fed commercial pellets, sometimes containing antibiotics to ward off disease. If ponds aren’t carefully managed, a sludge of fecal matter, chemicals, and excess food can build up and decay. Wastewater can be periodically discharged into nearby waterways. “Bacteria and algae can begin to grow and disease can set in, prompting farmers to use drugs and other chemicals that can remain on the shrimp and seep into the surrounding environment,” says Urvashi Rangan, Ph.D., executive director of the Consumer Reports Food Safety and Sustainability Center. Those shrimp-farming practices raise a variety of concerns—not just about how safe shrimp are to eat but also about the environmental damage that can be caused by farming them that way.

For shoppers the dilemma starts at the grocery store, where it’s difficult to know what to buy. Labels and names can be confusing, meaningless, or—worse—deceptive. Sellers may not always tell (or even know) the truth about the origins of the shrimp they offer. And the allure of a label proclaiming that shrimp are “natural” or “wild” can obscure the fact that some expensive varieties aren’t necessarily fresher or more flavorful.


What Consumer Reports tests showed: Bacteria and other problems

Despite America’s massive intake of shrimp, the Food and Drug Administration tested only 0.7 percent of foreign shrimp shipments last year. To do our own testing, Consumer Reports bought 342 packages of frozen shrimp—284 raw and 58 cooked samples—at large chain supermarkets, big-box stores, and “natural” food stores in 27 cities across the U.S. (We didn’t include fresh, never-frozen shrimp because they account for only a small percentage of the shrimp that consumers buy.)  

We tested for bacteria such as salmonella, vibrio, staphylococcus aureus, and E. coli. We also looked for drug residues to see whether antibiotics were used in raising the shrimp. Antibiotics—none of which are approved by the U.S. for shrimp farming and which are illegal in imported shrimp—are problematic because their use can ultimately lead to bacteria becoming antibiotic-resistant, meaning that at some point the antibiotic may no longer work to treat common human ailments.

Our findings provided some cause for concern. In 16 percent of cooked, ready-to-eat shrimp, we found several bacteria, including vibrio and E. coli. Those bacteria can potentially cause illnesses such as food poisoning—which could include diarrhea and dehydration—and, in rare instances, can even prove fatal. In 11 samples of raw imported farmed shrimp, we detected antibiotics. And in seven raw shrimp samples (six farmed and one wild), we found MRSA—methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus, a bacteria that can cause infections that are often difficult to treat.

Overall, 60 percent of our raw shrimp tested positive for bacteria, but it’s important to keep those findings in perspective. By comparison, in 2013, when we tested raw chicken breasts, 97 percent of the samples contained bacteria, says Rangan, who oversaw both the shrimp and chicken studies. Read "The High Cost of Cheap Chicken" for more details.

Compared with the chicken samples, far fewer shrimp contained salmonella, which is often responsible for outbreaks of food poisoning. But of concern, we found vibrio on many shrimp samples. “Vibrio is the most common cause of food poisoning from eating raw oysters,” Rangan says. “And even though most bacteria on shrimp would be killed during the cooking process, our test results raise real questions about how shrimp is raised, processed, and regulated.”

Dirty shrimp: What we found

Consumer Reports tested 284 samples of raw shrimp purchased at stores around the country and tested them for bacterial contamination. The last column shows the percentage of samples that contained at least one of the following bacteria: vibrio, staphylococcus aureus, E. coli, listeria, or salmonella—bacteria that can potentially make you sick. Our experts say more should be done to prevent contamination, but note that cooking should kill the bacteria.

Country of origin

Production type

No. of samples tested

Percent with bacteria

Bangladesh

Farmed

12

83%

India

Farmed

43

74%

Indonesia

Farmed

36

61%

Vietnam

40

58%

Thailand

Farmed

41

42%

Argentina

12

33%

U.S.

Wild

55

20%


Is ‘fresh’ or frozen better?

Another confusing choice for consumers is whether to buy the frozen shrimp you see in bags or the “fresh” shrimp at the seafood counter. If you’re buying from a gourmet seafood store or seaside market, you may find actual fresh shrimp, but the truth is that most shrimp you encounter in supermarkets have been frozen soon after they are caught, before they are shipped to stores. So there’s a very good chance that the glistening tray of shrimp at the seafood counter in your store was previously frozen, then thawed. “In fact,” says Steven Wilson, deputy director of the NOAA Fisheries Office of International Affairs and Seafood Inspection, “it could be the same shrimp that's in the freezer case—just defrosted.”

Can you trust the labels on shrimp?

Not always. “If a shrimp label says ‘Organic,’ ignore it,” Rangan advises. “There are no U.S. standards for the organic label when it comes to seafood, unlike for produce and meat.” The same goes for labels proclaiming that a package of shrimp is “Natural” or “Environmentally Aware.” We also picked up a bag of shrimp labeled “Chemical-free” (a claim that is not regulated), which tested positive for the antibiotics oxytetracycline and sulfamethoxazole. “Antibiotics are chemicals,” Rangan says. “Producers should be honest about how their shrimp is raised.”

The Department of Agriculture requires supermarkets and warehouse clubs to state whether shrimp is wild or farmed, along with its country of origin. But a 2014 Oceana study found that even those common classifications can be inaccurate. Oceana bought 143 shrimp samples from 111 vendors nationwide and ran DNA tests to figure out exactly what type, or species, they’d purchased. It turned out that 30 percent of the labels were misleading in some way. For example, in some cases farmed white-leg shrimp (the most commonly farmed shrimp globally) were sold as wild shrimp. “This is seafood fraud, especially given the far higher price of wild shrimp,” says study author and senior scientist Kimberly Warner, Ph.D. Oceana even found a small banded coral shrimp, which is not meant to be eaten, mixed into a bag of salad-sized shrimp.

How can a consumer make smart choices given those shady shrimp sellers? Marianne Cufone, an environmental attorney and executive director of the Recirculating Farms Coalition, says there are some clues that might help you distinguish wild from farmed. “Wild shrimp often vary in size, shape, and color because they don’t all have identical genetics,” she says. “Batches of farmed shrimp often all hatch at the same time, eat the same food, and live in the same environment, so they’re more likely to look the same.” Cufone’s second tip: “Look for poop, or what is politely called a vein.” Frequently, shrimp farmers stop feeding shrimp before harvesting them so that the vein empties. If you see a dark line, there’s a better chance it’s a real wild shrimp.

**The previous article was written by Consumer Reports and reflects the views of Consumer Reports only. There is no relationship between Consumer Reports and Dairyland Shrimp LLC**
story_txt:
Welcome to Dairyland ShrimpDairyland Shrimp LLC is a family-owned indoor shrimp farm that raises Pacific white shrimp where you would least expect it–in the middle of America’s Dairyland. We have the freshest shrimp you can find in Wisconsin! We guarantee fresh, healthy, responsibly-raised shrimp without antibiotics or added chemicals and hormones. Learn more about our shrimp farming process.Dairyland’s shrimp are sold alive and fresh. No chemicals or colorings are necessary to enhance the product, and our shrimp is more flavorful than frozen shrimp from the grocery store. You can feel good about eating our product because it is locally and sustainably grown and does not destroy natural ecosystems like the shrimp found in grocery stores. We have a few tasty shrimp recipes for you to enjoy.The truth about the shrimp you buy in the grocery store
Depletion of the world’s oceans has created the need for new, sustainable ways to produce seafood. This has been especially true in the case of shrimp. The world’s natural ecosystem is rapidly being destroyed and almost 95% of the shrimp we eat are now farm raised in open air ponds and imported from Southeast Asia and South America where loose environmental regulations and optimal climates allow for production all year round.

Viral diseases and challenges from the environmental community toward traditional shrimp farming have been making consumers more aware of shrimp farming’s many flaws like habitat destruction, effluents of contaminated waste water, and use of pesticides and hormones.

Now a new and sustainable way of shrimp farming has evolved that protects shrimp from disease and protects the environment from hazardous shrimp farming practices, creating the possibility that indoor shrimp farming could become the cleanest seafood industry in the world!

What is biofloc shrimp farming?Biofloc shrimp farming facilitates a bacterial community where the bacteria accumulate in clumps called flocs, which break down nitrogenous wastes and turn them into high-protein feed for the shrimp. The flocs process nitrogenous wastes and the shrimp feed on the flocs; this symbiotic relationship stabilizes water quality and supports rapid shrimp growth.
Our processAt Dairyland Shrimp LLC we use a biofloc heterotrophic saltwater system with zero water exchange; we re-circulate our water and therefore do not generate waste water. Waste feed and solids are diverted to clarifying tanks, where the solids settle and clear water is re-circulated back to the grow out tank. The floc also acts as part of the shrimp’s diet throughout the grow out period and the shrimp grow very efficiently, feeding off both the feed and the heterotrophic floc.
Our new facilityWe need your help to fund a sustainable indoor shrimp farming facility that will be completely independent from a power grid. This state of the art facility will implement solar power and geothermal heat. We want are building to be a model to other shrimp farmers to show them just how sustainable and ecofriendly seafood can be.    Here is how geothermal heat works.


Learn more about shrimp you find at the grocery store.(Consumer Reports article summarized)


Americans love shrimp



Each of us eats, on average, almost 4 pounds per year, making shrimp more popular than tuna. Once considered a special-occasion treat, shrimp has become so ubiquitous that we now expect to find it on the menu whether we’re at a pricey restaurant or a fast-food joint.


In fact, Americans eat about three times more shrimp than we did 35 years ago. To satisfy our insatiable appetite, the U.S. has become a massive importer: About 94 percent of our shrimp supply comes from abroad, from countries such as India, Indonesia, and Thailand.

But our love affair with shrimp does have a downside. Most of the shrimp we import is “farmed”—grown in huge industrial tanks or shallow, man-made ponds that can stretch for acres. In some cases 150 shrimp can occupy a single square meter (roughly the size of a 60-inch flat-screen television) where they’re fed commercial pellets, sometimes containing antibiotics to ward off disease. If ponds aren’t carefully managed, a sludge of fecal matter, chemicals, and excess food can build up and decay. Wastewater can be periodically discharged into nearby waterways. “Bacteria and algae can begin to grow and disease can set in, prompting farmers to use drugs and other chemicals that can remain on the shrimp and seep into the surrounding environment,” says Urvashi Rangan, Ph.D., executive director of the Consumer Reports Food Safety and Sustainability Center. Those shrimp-farming practices raise a variety of concerns—not just about how safe shrimp are to eat but also about the environmental damage that can be caused by farming them that way.

For shoppers the dilemma starts at the grocery store, where it’s difficult to know what to buy. Labels and names can be confusing, meaningless, or—worse—deceptive. Sellers may not always tell (or even know) the truth about the origins of the shrimp they offer. And the allure of a label proclaiming that shrimp are “natural” or “wild” can obscure the fact that some expensive varieties aren’t necessarily fresher or more flavorful.

Antibiotics—none of which are approved by the U.S. for shrimp farming and which are illegal in imported shrimp—are problematic because their use can ultimately lead to bacteria becoming antibiotic-resistant, meaning that at some point the antibiotic may no longer work to treat common human ailments.

Our findings provided some cause for concern. In 16 percent of cooked, ready-to-eat shrimp, we found several bacteria, including vibrio and E. coli. Those bacteria can potentially cause illnesses such as food poisoning—which could include diarrhea and dehydration—and, in rare instances, can even prove fatal. In 11 samples of raw imported farmed shrimp, we detected antibiotics. And in seven raw shrimp samples (six farmed and one wild), we found MRSA—methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus, a bacteria that can cause infections that are often difficult to treat.

By comparison, in 2013, when we tested raw chicken breasts, 97 percent of the samples contained bacteria, says Rangan, who oversaw both the shrimp and chicken studies. Read "The High Cost of Cheap Chicken" for more details.

Compared with the chicken samples, far fewer shrimp contained salmonella, which is often responsible for outbreaks of food poisoning. story:
What Is It? Who are we?

  • We are Velvet Steele and Jeff Bowen; artists, educators, advocates.
  • Eldorado Boutique is important to us because it will fill a gap in the community and provide a classy, upbeat, fun, safe, inclusive, and non-judgemental space for sex toys, education, art, and the people.
  • Contributors will allow us to push forward with our goals of making such a space possible.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We require $45,000 in funding.  This will go towards expanding our product line, securing store space in the area we plan to set up shop, renovating and outfitting our space with the necessary equipment, along with all of the associated costs of doing so(insurance, legal, advertising, supplies etc.) 
  • By donating you can receive store credit or erotic photo sets.  We are also open to other perks.  So, feel free to contact us to arrange an alternative.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, donated funds will still allow us to expand our product line and provide store credit for product through our website, as well as help us on our way to setting up more parties and events, as well as eventually securing our storefront.

The Impact

  • This project is important to us because it will provide a space that is much more than just a storefront; it will be a place of comfort to explore your sexuality and leisure, a place of education, a place of inclusivity and acceptance, as well as a place for art and appreciation of the human body.  All of this in a clean, classy, and genuinely fun environment.
  • We managed and worked at a similar store where we saw great success with our art galas and educational seminars.  We also set up at and support local sex parties and have started some of our own related events.
  • This is a real and important aspect of people's lives.  We have a breadth of knowledge and passion for reaching out to people and being able to help in any way we can with regards to sexuality, health/well-being, acceptance/inclusivity, and plain old fun!

Risks & Challenges

  • Securing the right space in the downtown west end may be a bit of a challenge.  Size, cost, and accessibility are extremely important and we can't sacrifice any of these things in our decision.
  • We began actively searching for and inspecting locations and will continue to do so while we raise funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, that's OK!  We welcome encouragement and would love it if you could spread the word about our company and our campaign.  Please share our campaign on social media or tell a friend or family member!  You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!!!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign!  We will be updating it with more content each week.  So please check back and we hope to see you in our store or at one of our events in the future!

story:
Who are we ?

  • We are a small family based collective, passionate about supplying organic, raw, golden nectar to our local community.
  • With a past in the holistic health food world, we love to enrich peoples life with top quality nourishment and are keen on green living and harmony with our beautiful earth.
  • Here at Honey Bee One we would love to establish a a trio of colonies to produce high quality, organic, raw, floral honey. Our ethos is green, friendly and non-invasive.
  • Your help would give us the boost we need to make a sustainable, ethically responsible, health giving future for us, our local flora and community.

Our Goals and your perks for donating

  • To achieve our goal we will need £2000. 
  • This will enable us to purchase:
  •  5 complete gabled hives made of cedar wood. (2 As anti swarming protection/spares for moving bees  around)
  • 3 Over wintered Queen Bee Nucleus's (A Queen bee, with eggs and drones). 
  • Body suit, Bee Hat, Gloves, and a few tools to make the job easier.
  • Our perks include £2000 worth of our pure top quality honey, delivered to your door in small batches as the season changes and as you finish your last batch !
  •  Large slabs of our delicious honey comb with honey.
  • Jars of our Pure Honey & Organic Rose Oil Infused Honey.
  • Organic Bees Wax Candles.

The Impact

Having Bees around us is vital to our existence on this earth.

  • Bees are in a "little" bit of trouble nowadays and they need our support! 
  • Establishing healthy hives and producing healing products is close to our hearts and we know it would really benefit our local community and planet earth !

Risks & Challenges

With Bees being under threat from an array of chemicals used in agricultrual and industry practice nowadays there is more risk of bees being harmed by humans than ever.

  • Our bees will be based in the heart of rural somerset surrounded by moorland and wildlife not industrial sites, and large scale agriculture.
  • We are using a completely organic, non-invasive technique, never harvesting too much honey, meaning not having to feed our bees sugar making for healthier, stronger, happier bees.
  • Also never culling of bees to prevent swarming, rather allowing them to grow to full capacity and then allowing them to swarm into a neighbouring baited hive (a perfect home for them) ready for them to move straight into.
  • These methods allow the bees to develop naturally as they like best and minimises disturbance and unnatural substances in their lives.

Please share 

  • If you love our idea then please share our campaign and help spread the word.

Thank you for giving us a moment of your precious time, all our best wishes to you, and remember,

Honey Bee One <3
story_txt:
Who are we ?

We are a small family based collective, passionate about supplying organic, raw, golden nectar to our local community.
With a past in the holistic health food world, we love to enrich peoples life with top quality nourishment and are keen on green living and harmony with our beautiful earth.
Here at Honey Bee One we would love to establish a a trio of colonies to produce high quality, organic, raw, floral honey. Our ethos is green, friendly and non-invasive.
Your help would give us the boost we need to make a sustainable, ethically responsible, health giving future for us, our local flora and community.

Our Goals and your perks for donating

To achieve our goal we will need £2000. 
This will enable us to purchase:
 5 complete gabled hives made of cedar wood. (2 As anti swarming protection/spares for moving bees  around)
3 Over wintered Queen Bee Nucleus's (A Queen bee, with eggs and drones). 
Body suit, Bee Hat, Gloves, and a few tools to make the job easier.
Our perks include £2000 worth of our pure top quality honey, delivered to your door in small batches as the season changes and as you finish your last batch !
 Large slabs of our delicious honey comb with honey.
Jars of our Pure Honey & Organic Rose Oil Infused Honey.
Organic Bees Wax Candles.

The Impact
Having Bees around us is vital to our existence on this earth.

Bees are in a "little" bit of trouble nowadays and they need our support! 
Establishing healthy hives and producing healing products is close to our hearts and we know it would really benefit our local community and planet earth !

Risks & Challenges
With Bees being under threat from an array of chemicals used in agricultrual and industry practice nowadays there is more risk of bees being harmed by humans than ever.

Our bees will be based in the heart of rural somerset surrounded by moorland and wildlife not industrial sites, and large scale agriculture.
We are using a completely organic, non-invasive technique, never harvesting too much honey, meaning not having to feed our bees sugar making for healthier, stronger, happier bees.
Also never culling of bees to prevent swarming, rather allowing them to grow to full capacity and then allowing them to swarm into a neighbouring baited hive (a perfect home for them) ready for them to move straight into.
These methods allow the bees to develop naturally as they like best and minimises disturbance and unnatural substances in their lives.

Please share 


If you love our idea then please share our campaign and help spread the word.

Thank you for giving us a moment of your precious time, all our best wishes to you, and remember,
Honey Bee One <3

story:
The Scoop

Hi!  I'm Natalie Boddeker, the owner and operator of Zest! Juice for Life.  Zest! was started after I watched a documentary called Fat, Sick and Nearly Dead.  It inspired me to go on a 50 day juice fast.  After that, I felt so great that I had to tell everyone I knew about juicing!  Soon, I started holding seminars and found that most people don't want to juice themselves, they would much rather buy it from me!  So, I began making and selling my cold pressed juice blends at the Community Farmers Market in Bowling Green, KY. We get the majority of our produce from our local farmer friends. In the past three years the Zest! team and I have had great success with our little business, but now it's time to grow and have juice available for folks every day of the week! Here's where you come in:

What We Need & What You Get

We have found the perfect "SPOT" for our shop and we know you'll love it too!  This part of the plan is a done deal, but the perfect spot costs BANK, so here's what we are thinking:

  • $2,300 for a beverage case to store the juice and other healthy food items.
  • $150 for large menu signs like this:


  • $300 for logo and store hours decals for front window
  • $486 for a Square restaurant point of sale kit
  • $475 to decorate walls (including a mural and shelves)


  • $100 for t-shirts or aprons for employees
Depending on what we receive, the items are listed in order of importance to us!
Every little bit helps us fund our dream, and you get goodies along the way, from Zest! stickers, to invitations to our launch party!


What This Means to Us and Our Community

I quit my job in a corporate environment to take a chance that the people of Bowling Green would be sold on juice- and they are!  My sweet customers want juice every day and I want to provide it for them in a beautiful, peaceful environment.  YOU can be a part of that!  Have I mentioned that we have found THE PERFECT "SPOT" (that's a hint!)


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can help financially, and we get that.  But don't let that stop you from spreading the word!  Please share with everyone you know!

    What This Means to Us and Our Community I quit my job in a corporate environment to take a chance that the people of Bowling Green would be sold on juice- and they are!  My sweet customers want juice every day and I want to provide it for them in a beautiful, peaceful environment.  YOU can be a part of that!  Have I mentioned that we have found THE PERFECT "SPOT" (that's a hint!)


    Other Ways You Can Help Not everyone can help financially, and we get that.  But don't let that stop you from spreading the word!  Please share with everyone you know!

story:
Hello! My name is Greg Raines, I am 25 years old and live for all things media. Ever since I picked up my first camera, I’ve been hooked. The first camera I was able to use was a disposable camera at my cousins wedding. I was all of about 8 years old and I blasted through the entire film in a matter of minutes. I then spent the rest of the wedding looking for other cameras to use to take even more pictures. The reality is, those pictures probably looked like absolute trash but there was something about capturing those moments that captivated my interest in such an intense way. From there I moved into wanting to film everything, from ghetto skateboarding videos with my friends to make believe talk shows. Really just anything we thought would be entertaining to watch over and over again. Now at the ripe age of 25, the majority of my creative outlet is centered around the church I attend, Church of Living Water, located in Olympia, WA. I have been blessed with the opportunity to help bring some really incredible creative projects to life. The last year and a half working with their media team has really solidified this passion in my heart and inspired me to pursue it as my career.

                                       

       One of the main reasons I wanted to be able to start my own business is because I want to be able to get to a place financially where I can afford to reach out to smaller churches, small local business and low income families, people who maybe cant afford to get family portraits of their kids, senior pictures, or a church that doesn't have the funding to make a really fun and awesome promo video for a summer camp or sermon series. Being in a place where I can say don't worry about the money right now and bless them with these services is my ultimate dream.


  This campaign is to help me launch my business, Lions Den Productions. LDP has a main focus of photography and film production. My mission is to provide people with a service of capturing the most memorable moments in their lives. I would like to use my talent and skills to help people tell their story. There is a story in every image and every film. It brings me so much joy to create an avenue where we get to tell these stories, allowing the viewers to feel the emotions that come with them. You, as contributors, are helping me do a couple things.

1.  Live out my dream of media production as my career.

2. Help tell stories in a new way, capturing some of the most precious and inspiring moments in our lives.

I know a lot of you are going to be asking where does the funding we donate go? Currently I am working as a delivery driver for a dairy company supplying stores with ice cream. I am blessed to have a job but sadly it does not fulfill my passion or fully fund this adventure of media production I am choosing to take. I am asking for $8500. What this money will go toward is buying professional gear that I will need to produce a high quality product that meets and exceeds my client’s dreams.

  I am not trying to get the top of line gear in the world because if we are honest, I don’t need it, at least not right now. Some of the main pieces of gear I will be purchasing are…

·  Canon 5D Mark II – This is a high quality DSLR camera that does both photos and video. ($2000)

·  Rokinon Cine Lens Kit – This is a lens kit that has 4 main lenses used for making incredible HQ film. ($2000)

·  Accessories – Tripods, extra batteries, SD memory cards, Steady cam, etc ($1000)

·  Photography Lens – 50mm, 24-70mm, 70-200mm ($1500)

. iMac equipped with Final Cut Pro X for video editing, Photoshop and Lightroom for photo editing ($2000) 

These are not exact number but they are very close estimates, of which all of your money will be used for. I want to be as transparent as possible with my supporters so if you have questions please feel free to ask!

  If my goal is not met, I will be scaling down on some of the pieces of gear that, although are defiantly needed, can be best set aside and purchased at a later date.

If, by the grace of God, my goal is met and then some, all the extra money goes right into buying more gear and into the business. Not a shopping spree of clothes and toys for myself. You work hard for your money and if you choose to donate it to me, I promise it will be used to bring this business to life and only that.

  I know times are tough for some people and if that means you are unable to financially contribute, you can still help! Help me spread the word. Help get this page out to as many people as possible. And help me reach my goal. It will not go unnoticed and I would appreciate it more then you could ever imagine.

Thank you so much for reading this and for your support! I can’t even begin to describe how much it means to me.

Currently I am working on my first feature film called Force Fighters: The Movie. Bringing this film to life is going to be an incredible experience and a ton of fun! I plan on keeping everyone who is interested in following me on this journey, updated on the progress of that film.Thank you.

story:
May was Maternal Mental Health Awareness month. During this month, I watched "The Babadook", and immediately saw the correlation. 


For me, the dark themes explored in this film symbolized mental and emotional states experienced by many women who, as mothers, deal with isolation, judgement, and an overall lack of support.  It is well documented that mothering in such conditions, combined, or not, with hormonal and biochemical changes, trauma, and predispositions, creates the alarming rates of  Postpartum Mood Disorders we are witnessing.

On the other side, statistics show that the PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL, EMOTIONAL, and SOCIAL SUPPORT from a Postpartum Doula or other non-judgmental care provider can reduce the risk or severity of Postpartum Mood Disorders.

Unfortunately, not everyone can afford full access to complementary health care.  The fact that financial stress is a further risk factor for Postpartum Mood Disorders means that those working with a lower income can benefit greatly from the support of a Postpartum Doula although they may be unable to budget for it.

My goal is to create complete access to the care from myself and another local Postpartum Doula by filling our scholarship funds so that families in need can apply and receive the care that is not a luxury but a RIGHT.  I am  hosting a special screening of "The Babadook" next month. For those who can't attend or who would like to donate more, I have created this fundraiser.
I will match all profits 100%. For every hour donated by you, I will give an extra hour of care to the families receiving the scholarships.

Resources:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B15-OMRh-mp5TDJweHVVR0E0MmM/view?usp=sharing

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B15-OMRh-mp5OWJvc2ZCdjhaaDA/view?usp=sharing
http://www.midwiferytoday.com/articles/postpartumdoula.asp
http://www.oregon.gov/dhs/ofra/Documents/HPH%20Jackson.pdf

story:
Welcome!

I want to first thank you for visiting my campaign page. 

My name is Sonja Klotz, and I am currently a volunteer programmer for a campus-community radio station CIVL 101.7FM which is based out of the University of the Fraser Valley (UFV) in Abbotsford, BC. Furthermore, I am also the vice-chair of CIVL's Board of Directors and have been solicited for National Campus and Community Radio Association Board for the 2015 By-Election. I have been with the radio station since November 2014, and have since then created and produced a spoken-word and music show called the Civl Oxfam Show. This is a weekly hour-long show that is hosted and produced by a team of students from the Oxfam-UFV club.

I am writing to you because CIVL Radio 101.7FM and the Oxfam University of the Fraser Valley Club have a unique opportunity  to attend the World Association of Community Radio Broadcasters (also known as: AMARC in French)  Conference. This occurs once every four to five years this time with the addition of Indymedia Africa Working Group Open Space Initiatives in Accra, Ghana. IndyMedia Africa is a global network of media activists launched in 1999 to establish open-source, participator, multimedia publishing sites to support social movements of equality and diversity. Today the network has touched over 150 countries worldwide and remains active on the African continent. 

The event takes place this August 4th-15th. I am requesting financial sponsorship that will not only benefit me as a radio programmer, but also the diverse communities represented in the Civl Oxfam Show.

The purpose of our show is to promote and raise awareness about current and pressing issues pertaining to gender justice, environmental justice, children, immigrants and Indigenous communities both locally and nationally. We also strive to provide a safe and empowering platform for all voices across Canada and worldwide. I would like to introduce the Civl Oxfam show to IndyMedia and would also like to  provide a workshop specific to social justice programming and environmental sustainability through gender equality. 


Thank you for your time and consideration!

Sonja Klotz

Civl Oxfam Show

Executive Producer

PS: To learn more about our Civl Oxfam Show and our community involvement please "Like" us on our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/civloxfamufv

To hear us live tune into www.civl.ca or 101.7FM in the Fraser Valley on Tuesday afternoons at 5pm-Civl Oxfam Show!

story:
Jason and Kristen have a dream to provide the Eastern Panhandle of WV with the craft beer that it is so utterly deprived of. They have been dreaming, and planning, and striving, to start up theIrie Elephant Brewing Company in Martinsburg.  Local craft culture makes any town special. The hope is that Irie Elephant would help to stimulate the depressed local economy and revitalize the old downtown Martinsburg area.Irie Elephant will strive to use local ingredients, sponser local events, and contribute to the restoration and sustainability of the community. 

These guys are not business tycoons, Jason is a meter reader/professional wrestler and Kristen is a enviornmental contractor. They are not doing this to make millions, they just want to live the dream of working hard at doing something that they love. It's really that simple. Kristen and Jason would also love to have a legacy to leave their three sons.  They plan to show the kids first hand, through Irie Elephant, that they can do anything they put thier minds to. They believe in the importance of small family businesses, community, and the quality and value of craft products.  These are the kind of family values that need to be instilled in the next generation.

Any donations you make will go directly toward funding this endeavor. 

Irie Elephant is all about one love, happy times, and good beer. Please help us make this dream a reality.

story:
We're funding airfare and daily meals.

We'll add a hotel room if we can. Cheryl and Jordan graciously offered to share their hotel room, but private, "get away from the crowd" space would be great for the wee child.

For those who like numbers:

Membership: $50

Airfare: $700-$800 for fares, fees, and taxes for two round-trip flights

Food:
$150.00 cheap healthier meals supplemented by hospitality
$175.00 above + healthier snacks
$225.00 above + one nicer meal with con family

Room:
$315.00 if sharing (covers share of tax & housekeeping tips)
$630.00 if not sharing (covers tax & housekeeping tips)

Etc.:
$50.00 for something commemorative each
$100.00 for one night of babysitting
$75 Super Shuttle or parking to/from airport

Totals:
Frugal Minimum: $1215
Conservative Niceties: $1930

For those who like plans & perks:

Thanks to everyone who has pitched in so far - Grace will dedicate her volunteer time to all who have helped and is designing a brand-new costume for herself and Lil Sparkle to honour the mighty conjuring wrought here, since the total collected so far guarantees attendance!

If full amount is achieved:

kid-focused room party & sleepover one con night, so friend/donor parents can have fun without worrying or paying for a sitter.

costume prep and snacks pre-func on another con night to finish getting ready as a group before a wild time. Extra:  fully-licensed, background-checked childcare professional will take over the room after with room to free up yet another night for a small number of parent friends.

extra-special badge ribbons for campaign sponsors & the other folks who have made this possible by sharing and caring.
