story:
The Need

Seven years ago, Guy Sussman founded FestivalTrek when he realized there was no website dedicated to helping festival-goers discover new events in their areas. Since that time, FestivalTrek has grown to be the leading search engine for festivals (and conventions, fairs, workshops, parades, concert series, live shows... you get the idea). You can check it out right now at FestivalTrek.com

It has always been our top priority for FestivalTrek to remain a free, community-driven resource: no fees, no pop-up ads, nothing to distract from the festivals themselves. But the time has come for FestivalTrek to get an overhaul, so we're turning to your, our community, to make it possible.

Raising $10,000 will allow us to enact a complete browser interface redesign. What that means is that the entire look of the website will change. Gone will be the bulky, square buttons and bare-bones, no-frills lists of the past. Instead, we'll have a new layout that will be fast, intuitive, and fun to use.

Additional funds will allow us to improve the search engine optimization, which means people searching for festivals on Google and other search engines will see festivals listed on FestivalTrek first, bringing more people into our community. We'll also be able to add several exciting new features to the website, like membership benefits to replace and enhance the MyList feature, private messaging, reviews, images, maps, ride share services, and more.

So watch our video and check out our website at FestivalTrek.com, if you haven't already. If you like what you see (and we think you will!) join with us and help FestivalTrek become the very best service that it can be,

What You Get

We have three tiers of rewards for contributors to ensure that you can find that level of giving that's right for you.

The first tier is for casual festival-goers. These perks include internet immortality in the form of listing on our Contributors page, a personalized thank-you e-mail from our founder, and neat FestivalTrek clothing. This level of giving is perfect for FestivalTrek members and visitors who want to show their support without getting more deeply involved.

The second their of rewards is designed to help festival promoters. Giving at this level will boost events you're involved with to the top of search result listings and even get your festival listed on our front page. If you have admin powers on any festivals on FestivalTrek, this is the level for you!

The final tier is for the most serious of FestivalTrekkers. As a partner, you'll become an actual member of the FestivalTrek team. Aside from receiving personal communications from us and listing as a partner on our website, any requests you have in regards to special features and the future of FestivalTrek we will strive to realize. We look forward to having you on-board. 

Risks & Challenges

FestivalTrek has maintained a stable online presence for seven years and isn't going anywhere any time soon. Short of an unforeseen act of god, there are no risks of our website failing.  

If we fall short of our goal, we will have to make some tough decisions about how to prioritize our funds: which features we can add, and what we'll have to do without. But no matter how much money we raise, we are committed to improving FestivalTrek to the best of our ability. 

Who We Are

I'm Guy Sussman and I recently turned 70!  Doesn't feel like I imagined, but no complaints.  As an avid lover of music and dance festivals, I was disappointed to find no suitable website where I could find my type of festival when and where I wanted. So, in 2007, I created FestivalTrek.com but I created it for ALL types of events. Before becoming a programmer I was a retailer in New York City, a photographer who studied with Ansel Adams and a teacher.  Nowadays, I just go to music events, work on FestivalTrek and have fun.

Sam Tillis is a writer, teacher, copy editor, web guru, and theatre artist based in Oakland, CA. He graduated summa cum laude from the University of California San Diego with BAs in Political Science and Theatre in 2007, and has worked on a staggering array of projects since then, from editing and writing for local food magazine Edible East Bay to scaring tourists at the San Francisco Dungeon, from founding his own theatre company to operating FestivalTrek. His favorite festivals tend to start with "comic" and end with "con."

Other Ways You Can Help

Once you've contributed, make sure to help spread the word to your festival-going friends:

-Post about this campaign on the social media outlet of your choice.
-Like our Facebook page to receive the latest updates.
-Spread the word at any festivals you attending during our campaign. 

And of course, don't forget to visit FestivalTrek.com for all of your festival finding needs!

Aside from receiving personal communications from us and listing as a partner on our website, any requests you have in regards to special features and the future of FestivalTrek we will strive to realize. We look forward to having you on-board. 

    Risks & Challenges FestivalTrek has maintained a stable online presence for seven years and isn't going anywhere any time soon. Short of an unforeseen act of god, there are no risks of our website failing.  
If we fall short of our goal, we will have to make some tough decisions about how to prioritize our funds: which features we can add, and what we'll have to do without. But no matter how much money we raise, we are committed to improving FestivalTrek to the best of our ability. 
 

Who We AreI'm Guy Sussman and I recently turned 70!  Doesn't feel like I imagined, but no complaints.  As an avid lover of music and dance festivals, I was disappointed to find no suitable website where I could find my type of festival when and where I wanted. So, in 2007, I created FestivalTrek.com but I created it for ALL types of events. Before becoming a programmer I was a retailer in New York City, a photographer who studied with Ansel Adams and a teacher.  Nowadays, I just go to music events, work on FestivalTrek and have fun.

Sam Tillis is a writer, teacher, copy editor, web guru, and theatre artist based in Oakland, CA. He graduated summa cum laude from the University of California San Diego with BAs in Political Science and Theatre in 2007, and has worked on a staggering array of projects since then, from editing and writing for local food magazine Edible East Bay to scaring tourists at the San Francisco Dungeon, from founding his own theatre company to operating FestivalTrek. His favorite festivals tend to start with "comic" and end with "con."
   Other Ways You Can Help Once you've contributed, make sure to help spread the word to your festival-going friends:
-Post about this campaign on the social media outlet of your choice.-Like our Facebook page to receive the latest updates.-Spread the word at any festivals you attending during our campaign. 
And of course, don't forget to visit FestivalTrek.com for all of your festival finding needs!

story:
A little about the Farm

    My wife and I have always grown our own food usually nothing but a small garden and whatever we could cram in pots on the porch due to our confined urban settings in Colorado. When we realized we were expecting  our first child we knew it was time to move on to more wide open spaces in hopes to raise our son in the ways of sustainable living and teach him to grow his own food. So I called up my long time friend in southeast Louisiana (where my Brit & I were raised) who had just purchased his family's dairy farm property and asked him if he would be interested in doing a little organic farming.

He was all in.

          


     With shovels in  hands we packed up our bags and headed back down south to get our hands dirty. We immediately started working the soil and figuring out a good system of growing. After the birth of our son and 2 years of getting the soil where we liked it we have managed to drum up a pretty good following in the community thanks to the local farmers market. Also our neighbor farmers who have helped us every step of the way.

     On the Farm we grow mixed vegetables from potatoes to greens to tomatoes. We are practicing sustainable organic growing techniques including green manure, crop rotation, and compost tea that supplies our community with fresh veggies through the local farmers market year round and through the bi-weekly farm box we will starting this spring.

     Our goal with the high tunnel is to extend our growing season on certain crops that do not fare well in the summer heat and rain in the deep south so we can supply our community with a weekly farm box giving them access to better tasting and healthier food for their families and ours.    

             This is what we need your help for

 

                                 

 

  Farming and feeding people is all we have ever wanted to do and with this high tunnel YOU can make this dream  a reality. 

    High tunnels are often confused with greenhouses in that they are plastic coverings that protect your plants from the elements. But unlike Greenhouses tunnels are used to cover sensitive crops in rows like tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, cucumbers, and squash (which is what we plan on putting in ours) while greenhouses are mostly used to germinate seeds and prepare transplants.

     High tunnels are structures constructed of a metal frame covered with a single layer of 6 mil greenhouse grade plastic. They have high ceilings which allow us to fit our tractor in and work with ease. Tunnels are a simple, relatively inexpensive, and effective way of protecting sensitive crops from the effects of marginal low to high temperatures, wind, rain ,some insect and disease pests, as well as wildlife damage.

     Upon receiving funding for the high tunnel we will stuff it full of fresh non-gmo organic veggie transplants that we started in the greenhouse to fill our first season of farm boxes.

     We will also be using some of the funding for a new wheel seeder, a walk behind tiller, and pumps for the compost tea system as we will be using compost tea on drip irrigation to fertilize the rows in the high tunnel.

Heres a breakdown of how the funds will be used

Materials and labor for high tunnel using chainlink tubing

  • post and anchor legs                                           $200
  • ratchet tie down to prevent wind damage   $140
  • nuts, bolts, and screws                                        $40
  • tunnel bows                                                             $890
  • tunnel purlines                                                        $260
  • cross-connectors                                                   $110
  • 8' aluminum wire locks and wiggle wire         $270
  • 48' x  150' poly 6-mil tufflite iv                           $450
  • treated lumber for baseboards & sides
  1. 2x4x12               $180
  2. 2x6x12               $210
  3. 2x4x16               $90
  • hand cranks for sidewalls                    $60
  • labor (10/hr  day $15/hr)                   $300
  • wheel seeder                                           $150
  • air pumps for compost tea                 $150
  • drip tape for irrigation                          $300
  • walk behind tiller                                    $200
                                       grand total ----------$4000

                                         

                                                 This is our goat milk soap!

           What these guys got awesome perks?!                                             Get outta town!

YES......we sure do. Homemade goodies like goat milk soap, T-shirts, and seeds to help you start your own garden to help you connect to the farm as a thanks for your investment. What's better feeling then being a part of helping a community driven family farm reach their goal....especially when you get neat-o gifts for it.

            So you can't afford to help right now?

That's fine ...there are other ways you can help. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and tell your friends to join us on our little adventure. 

....and you wanna donate more than we have in the perks just drop me an e-mail and we can work that out for you.

                  Thanks for checking us out and keep on growing!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joni Rainbow and my partner Mark Roberts are co-founders of Uskate a not for profit organisation teaching extreme sports and circus skills to all ages across Devon and Cornwall.

We have an indoor Skatepark and Training centre in Tavistock which is open seven days a week 10.30am-10.30pm we have built a park the best we can with limited funds but we want to create and amazing skatepark with a brilliant selection of ramps and transitions.

With your support we can make this happen and then our young members will be able to have an even better space to develop them selves and support each other.

What We Need & What You Get

We need materials and wood to build a raised skatepark with half pipe.

  • £7000 on wood - we have been told by travis perkins they will double what we buy so for £7000 we will receive £14000 worth of wood.
  • £3000 materials, screws and varnish etc - same for these cost we will receive double the amount so £6000 worth of materials will be received.
  • the funds raised will go into providing a better skatepark for all.

The Impact

  • Uskate has been run by volunteers for over 5 years now and we have got this far but we need more support to ensure we can better the benefits we are providing for many people of all ages.
  • Uskate started as one after school club in Horrabridge with 4 volunteers, we now have over 45 registered volunteers, teach in three schools, teach at festivals all summer, have a skate and circus shop, have our indoor skatepark and we are growing at a progressive speed. 
  • help us turn our park into an amazing skatepark people travel to use.

  • Uskate has been teaching extreme sports and circus skills for over six years too all ages across Devon and Cornwall... We opened our Skatepark and Training centre open February this year... 

    Having the centre has made us able to open up and increase of young people being able to become full time members to our organisation, and we aim to start apprenticeships in September... 

    Now the centre is helping the positive development of so many young people and we have create a safe environment for young people to come and be supported through their own progress and growth as people.. But we need the park to be rebuilt... This will increase the amount of high end skaters using the park which will increase the income coming into the business, as a not for profit organisation this will enhance us being able to support and help more young people....

    Me and may partner have been volunteer tearing for over six years now to help as many young people become confident, well developed and skilled in many activities to help them realise their own personal abilities.... 

    But we need support the skatepark and centre is covering its own running costs but we want to get this rebuild done over the summer as we know it will help further uskate growth...

    So please give a small donation to help us meet our goal and encourage your friends and family to support the future generations being able to have belief in the, selves and to feel they have a chance of achieving anything they work hard for....


Risks & Challenges

  • You might wander why i have not included costs of labor well this is because we have a team of skilled carpenters as volunteers who are waiting to be able to start work on building the new park. 

  • If you are not able to support with money please share with your friends and help us make this a reality.
  • Please remeber to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our family business needs your help! We have to get our most loved product nutritionally analysed in order to keep selling it, so we’ve decided to offer fantastic discounts and subscription deals to all of our customers, old and new.

New laws state that we have to display the nutritional content on all products. The cost of the analysis for our blend is around £5,000 and we simply don’t have that kind of money sitting in the bank. It has to be done by 2016 or we’ll have to stop selling our beloved blend!

Marvellous Superfood has never been about profit. Our main focus is producing excellent products and making them available to all. A substantial number of the packages we send out each day go to people suffering from cancer or other serious conditions. We don’t profit from people’s misfortune and are proud to offer our products at the cheapest possible price to those who are battling with ill health.

We run the company as ethically and economically as humanly possible but we’ve had some big expenses recently. The expansion of our production space from a home environment into a dedicated facility has made it much easier for us to operate but has left us strapped for cash. So jump on board and help us keep this budding business afloat!

If we exceed our target we’ll invest in promotion and product development.

story:
Hello everyone, 

Onto this amazing land we open our hearts and welcome those who find themselves here! As many of you know, we left our long time Santa Barbara, California home and community last October and planted ourselves deeply in the ecosystem of southwestern Oregon.

Upon first sight of this forest-fringed mountain prairie it was clear that this was the place that inherently held the vision which brought us here and beckoned us to surrender ourselves completely to its manifest creation!

That vision is to create a small, discreet place of retreat for our beloved community and those who choose to wander here. A retreat focused on ceremonial meditation woven inseperably by spiritual study.

Our focus is to provide rest and healing for the world weary: a place to sit in group meditation with sacred song (icaros); a place for those on the threshold of death to be lovingly supported through their journey and embraced by nature & peace; an opportunity for a variety of teachers to share their wisdom and for others to receive their teachings. Our vision includes supporting right livelihood for our teachers and maestros. 

This will be a place to gather as we explore, integrate, surrender and awaken to this magical mystery that is Divine Communion; our True Selves. 

Teachings we have in mind are Tibetan Buddhism and the wisdom teachings of other eastern traditions, yoga, breath work, primitive skills, natural building, permaculture, herbology and plant medicinals using local and wildcrafted herbs and mushrooms. This is just a primary list... . we have many teachers in our community who are interested and inspired to hold courses here!

**An integral step toward the realization of this community vision is to raise our first yurt!! 

ALL contributions will go DIRECTLY to the purchase of a 21' yurt and to the necessary decking materials!**

Initially this yurt will provide necessary shelter for friends/helpers who will arrive in the fall and contribute their time and energy to a multitude of infrastructure projects: installing a solar system and water lines, planting fruit trees and preparing the gardens, AND building the deck and raising the yurt!! 

Once we've installed our basic infrastructure this yurt will be opened to holding our first community gatherings and courses!! 

Please feel free to forward this campaign to anyone you feel might resonate with this project. We appreciate any support you may have to offer with heartfelt gratitude; no amount is too small.

Eternal blessings and thank you for hearing the song...

story:
About Us

Laura, Allie, and Nate are three college students whose passion to help others and see the world made them very suitable for Climb for Sight. A future optometrist, Laura, had great interest in devoting her time to Vision for the Poor and extended the invitation to her college roommate, Allie, and hometown friend, Nate. 

Allie and Laura have shared an incredible friendship over the past few years, rooted in common interests and goals, and strong support of each other's aspirations. The decision to take on Mt. Kili together was a no-brainer! 

Laura and Nate grew up together as members of Lakewood Church.  They have been involved with volunteer work from a young age and have shared many memories helping others.  They are so excited to be able to add this to the list!      

Climb for Sight is a fundraising program sponsored by Vision for the Poor. The proceeds contribute to pediatric sight-saving eye surgeries and eye glasses. We're asking you to help us reach our goal and be a part of a life-changing experience with us!

Vision for the Poor

Vision for the Poor is a nonprofit organization that addresses the injustices in eye care in the developing world by funding the development of social service eye hospitals. Only by eliminating all barriers to access eye care by the poor can avoidable blindness be eliminated.

Vision for the Poor's mission is to reduce human suffering and improve quality of life through the recovery of sight by building sustainable eye hospitals in developing countries, empowering local eye specialists, funding essential ophthalmic infrastructure and establishing partnerships with like-minded agencies.

Our Goal:

We have set our crowd-funding goal at $7,000 to augment our larger goal of $30,000. Your contribution will directly help us each reach our goal. At such a rate, we will be able to provide 155 sight-saving surgeries. Children under the age of 14 receive free care at the clinics as a result of the contributions from people like you who support climbers like us!

The Impact

Vision for the Poor's Service Record since 1997: 
  • 430,000 patients treated
  • 27,000 sight-restoring surgeries performed (3,250 pediatric)
  • 65,000 new eye glasses dispensed

YOU can be part of giving the gift of sight!! 

In Guatemala alone, there are over 5,000 children in need of sight-saving surgery for conditions such as congenital cataracts, corneal transplants, congenital glaucoma, and crossed eyes. Vision for the Poor’s goal is to fund surgeries for all children who have no means for seeking adequate eye treatment. A donation of just $200 could save a child from a life lived in darkness!

It is estimated that over 86,000 children in Guatemala are in need of eyeglasses. A new pair of eyeglasses cost $20. 

The gift of sight is a gift of eternity. The ability to see gives way to endless opportunities in day to day life including one's independence!

How You Can Help

We ask that you find an amount that you are comfortable giving. No donation is too small, every dollar makes a difference! Here is what your contribution can provide:

  1. 1/2 penny per foot    = $97         = 1/2 sight-restoring surgery
  2. 1 penny per foot       = $194       = 1 surgery
  3. 2 cents per foot         = $388       = 2 surgeries
  4. 5 cents per foot         = $970       = 5 surgeries
  5. 10 cents per foot       = $1,940    = 10 surgeries
  6. 25 cents per foot       = $4,850    = 25 surgeries
  7. $1.00 per foot            = $19,400  = anesthesia equipment at a new Vision for the Poor eye clinic

Be sure to share our video!

We'd like to thank Lisa Gensheimer for the photos. Thank you, Lisa!

Our Goal: We have set our crowd-funding goal at $7,000 to augment our larger goal of $30,000. Your contribution will directly help us each reach our goal. At such a rate, we will be able to provide 155 sight-saving surgeries. Children under the age of 14 receive free care at the clinics as a result of the contributions from people like you who support climbers like us!   The Impact
Vision for the Poor's Service Record since 1997: 

430,000 patients treated
27,000 sight-restoring surgeries performed (3,250 pediatric)
65,000 new eye glasses dispensed
 


YOU can be part of giving the gift of sight!!   
In Guatemala alone, there are over 5,000 children in need of sight-saving surgery for conditions such as congenital cataracts, corneal transplants, congenital glaucoma, and crossed eyes. Vision for the Poor’s goal is to fund surgeries for all children who have no means for seeking adequate eye treatment. A donation of just $200 could save a child from a life lived in darkness!
It is estimated that over 86,000 children in Guatemala are in need of eyeglasses. A new pair of eyeglasses cost $20. 
The gift of sight is a gift of eternity. The ability to see gives way to endless opportunities in day to day life including one's independence!
How You Can Help
We ask that you find an amount that you are comfortable giving. No donation is too small, every dollar makes a difference! Here is what your contribution can provide:

1/2 penny per foot    = $97         = 1/2 sight-restoring surgery
1 penny per foot       = $194       = 1 surgery
2 cents per foot         = $388       = 2 surgeries
5 cents per foot         = $970       = 5 surgeries
10 cents per foot       = $1,940    = 10 surgeries
25 cents per foot       = $4,850    = 25 surgeries
$1.00 per foot            = $19,400  = anesthesia equipment at a new Vision for the Poor eye clinic


Be sure to share our video!
We'd like to thank Lisa Gensheimer for the photos. Thank you, Lisa!

story:
Help Introduce a Frozen Yogurt Shop in Swaziland

HELP INTRODUCE A FROZEN YOGURT SHOP IN SWAZILAND

Hello, my name is Gcinekile “G” Mavimbela and I am 26 years old from the Kingdom of Swaziland. Swaziland is a small landlocked country in Southern Africa known for its wilderness reserves and festivals showcasing traditional Swazi culture. Although the great attractions, Swaziland is faced with high poverty and a lot of children lack basic needs such as food, shelter and clothing. My goal is to find a sustainable way of helping under privileged children in the country. Therefore, I plan to introduce a frozen yogurt business and use a proportion of the profits to support orphans in the country. All your generous gifts towards establishing the frozen yogurt shop will continuously support Swazi children for generations.

Frozen yogurt will be a healthy substitute for ice cream in the country for both the local people and the large number of tourists that the country receives yearly. The shop will be operated in a city called Ezulwini known for tourist attractions. I will sell and market a variety of frozen yogurt flavors with natural and artificial toppings. It will be a self-service, creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere.

Every Contribution Matters!

Frozen yogurt is my favorite treat in the US and I thought it would be wise to use my favorite treat to pursue my passion. A generous donor has agreed to match, dollar to dollar, every gift to this campaign, so your contribution will have double the impact, $25, 000 raised through this campaign will actually result in $50, 000 towards the cost of the frozen yogurt setup. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please kindly get the word out and share my campaign.

story:
My name is Audrey Simper and I’m a photographer. I’ve decided to take a big step and follow my boyfriend Yoni to Israel this summer in order to support him as he launches his start-up, The Israel Immersion Program. I was also planning to get some amazing footage of the landscape, culture, and people in Israel and Greece.

I’ve covered Israel North to South and you can see some of the photos I’ve taken here http://audreysimper.pass.us/israel I want to do the same in Greece because of its rich culture and beautiful, colorful scenery. If you help me not only can I promise to show you through my photography journey where your donation/support went but also dedicate a personal photo to YOU.

In addition, if you choose to support my journey with $10 or more, I will personally send you a photography print from my travels. All the images will be continuously added to this growing gallery here: http://audreysimper.pass.us/israel
You can choose an image by September, as that’s when I arrive home and will send out all of the prints.

If there was ever a time I needed the support of my friends, family and photography fans – it is now. If you help me, I will be the happiest fairy in all of the land.

Much Love,

Audrey

story:
Hello!  My name is Walyn Vannurden husband to Jennifer Vannurden and father to three beautiful children, Alaina, Mark, and Kahlan.  I am a current member of the of the North Dakota Army National Guard, a two time deployed Veteran to Afghanistan in support of Operation Enduring Freedom, and I work as a federal officer at the United States border with Canada.  My wife, Jenn, is my awesome full time stay-at-home mother. 

We are starting this campaign to fund our business called Dakota Party Rentals.  Jennifer and I think it is really important to spread happiness and joy throughout our community. That is why we are choosing  a business that provides children and adults with nothing but pleasure and entertainment.  Our motto is "We Bring the Party!" 

We are asking for contributions to help achieve our goal of funding our new business, Dakota Party Rentals.  The contributions will be used to purchase inflatables and other rentals that are "Made in the U.S.A", equipment, a trailer to store and haul the inflatables, insurance, a website that has the capability to book and pay online, and cover any other startup expenses. 

We are seeking 30,000 dollars. All contributions would have a big impact in helping our business get off the ground running.  With any luck, we will be ready to launch our business in the spring of 2016 or sooner just in time for good weather. 

We will be offering some awesome perks, especially awesome for people in our area. Our perks will include discounts, large discounts, and/or free full day rentals!  What a great way to get an amusement business started and get your first rental reserved!

We know starting up a business can be risky, but we are managing the risk by starting small and growing steadily.  Even if we don't reach our goal at the end of this campaign, all funds raised will go towards the funding startup expenses for Dakota Party Rentals.  We know it can be tough to start a business in today’s environment, but we are committed and we are seeking other funding methods like business loans.

Please spread the word about our campaign so we can bring this great business to Northwestern North Dakota!  Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Thank you for checking out our campaign.  Thank you to everyone that helps.  It means a lot to my family!

Like us on Facebook! Dakota Party Rentals

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Angel and I am the owner of Angels' Essentials; a small wellness centre/boutique in Bedford NS that is situated in The Canadian Chinese Acupuncture College. 
  I have had a dream to add an Aura Cafe/Alternative Health Library to my existing business for the past year.  By doing this I hope to enable students in the college as well as visitors experience a "Zen'd out" environment that will benefit many people in this stressfilled go go go world.  My ultimate goal is to provide a space for people to be surrounded by knowledge, stillness and like minded individuals. 
  

What We Need & What You Get

To complete this project we are in need of aprox. $50k.  Here is the breakdown of where your funds will go;
-renovations (patio, plumbing, island, fountain, lighting, flooring, paint etc)-$25,000
-aura machine-$12,000
-furniture, decorative fixtures, kitchen cupboards, etc-$10,000
-Cafe machines/Vitamix/fridge-$3000
We don't expect you to just give your hard earned money to us. For every $ you donate we will provide you will a very unique well deserved exchanges so that you will feel like your contribution wasn't wasted.
If we don't meet our entire $50k goal it's ok! Whatever money we do raise will go towards the project all the same.

The Impact

Currently when folks come to the store and chat about their spiritual experiences/interesting life adventures I always feel bad bc I don't have anywhere for them to sit and be comfortable for an extended period of time.  Having a cafe/library will provide such a space.  I also think every college needs a place for their students to hang out and socialize over great coffee.
 The addition of the Aura Machine in the cafe will enhance awareness about the connection between the spiritual and physical bodies.  What I appreciate most about this unique machine is that it brings together my love of color and passion for alternative healing.  I hope to share that passion with all who visit.
   I strongly feel that the Aura Cafe will become a soothing and healing location for all those that visit.  I also plan on making this cafe the very first "Pay what you Can" coffee/health zone in Atlantic Canada!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially that's ok! If you could share this campaign to your network that would be so helpful.

story:
Hi, I'm Shannon, and I’m a indulgence creator! 

My passion for baking started when I was knee high  to a grasshopper and my nan would always have me help in her kitchen whenever I came to stay during the holidays. (can you believe that she is about to turn 101! and is still going strong). Growing up, I would be the one that made most of the desserts or cakes for the after dinner treat. Or sometimes it would be biscuits and slices to take to school the next day.

Fast forward to the year 2012 and I found myself feeling anxious and getting bored  - after being an Administrator/Office Manager for well over 20 years. So I finally decided to do something about doing "my own thing". It all started a couple of Christmas's ago, when I decided to experiment with nougat. I ended up giving them away as Christmas presents, and to my surprise, everyone couldn't stop raving about how incredible it tasted.  Hmmm, this reaction got me seriously thinking.   So I took a crazy beautiful leap of faith and "Eat Sweet" came to life. 

My aim was to not only provide an income for myself, but to also fill a niche in the market for unique contemporary products using only the highest quality, all natural ingredients.

My first creation was Raspberry and White Chocolate Nougat.  I played around with fresh berries, drying them and tweaking my recipe until it was perfect. (Can you believe that I still go to the extreme of picking each raspberry to this day!?)

 Slowly I came up with another 4 flavours and decided that it was ready to take the next step. It took me another 18 progressive months to get to the point of launching, as I wanted everything to be way better than just right. Flavours, packaging, logo design...

We launched close to 2 years ago, at The Good Food and Wine event held in Bendigo.  We first started out with 5 flavours of nougat (which has now grown to 6) with even more sweet flavours  in the pipe works.  This period was a huge learning curve and we have certainly endured a lot of ups and downs along with many stories to tell.

We have now excitedly added meringue kisses to our range.  Not only do we have them at all of our markets, we are also getting a lot of requests for sweet custom orders.


*Our Orange, Pecan and Maple Nougat


The response to my delicious creations has been fantastic! "Eat Sweet" has become a successful business with a loyal customer base and has  a reputation for the most amazing products . 

I've had well though out plans for "Eat Sweet" right from the beginning. Year one was without doubt a lot of hard work with lots of sweet steps along the way. I continued to juggle part time work (which was close to full) whilst trialling and creating new flavours and planning out where I wanted "Eat Sweet" to head. Those “sweet steps” have now led me to the point where I am working full time and ready to expand and start implementing some aspects of what I call 'My Sweet Dream '. 


*Raspberry and White Chocolate

At the moment, Eat Sweet is limited to selling at the local markets, pop ups in corporate foyers and customer orders received via any of the online shops. (Etsy, Made It, Eat Sweet online store) My vision is to have my product on those gourmet market shelves and exclusive hampers.


I currently operate out of my Home Registered Kitchen and do everything with precision by hand. That being, all the nougat is made by hand, cut by hand and packaged by hand as you can see in the video above. I am at the point that if I wish to take on the retail sector, something needs to give and cutting the nougat slabs is the biggest time consumer. 

So the big bottom line is that we are in desperate need of a bench top cutting machine!!!! This will save a crazy  amount of time with every slab that needs cutting! This in turn will give us more time to produce more of those sweet slabs and create new flavours for all our new and loyal customers!


Current french style nougat flavours include :Raspberry & White Chocolate, Chocolate & Smoked Salt with Hazelnuts, Orange & Maple with Pecans, Peanut & Coconut, Apple & Cinnamon with Walnuts and finally Musk - If you are an Aussie, you will definitely know this flavour well!


 *Some of our range of nougat

So that's where all my sweet eaters come in! In order to do this to the standard and quality I envision, I need to raise some sweet funds. 

I have set my target at $20,000.  

  1. This will cover the cost of a bench top cutting machine which will allow me take this sweet leap and have my most popular flavours sitting on those shelves. This is our biggest expense being well over $10,000!
  2. It will also help with purchasing packaging and retail labels in bulk for both the nougat and  meringue range.  This is always our biggest ongoing expense, buying in bulk will mean cheaper pricing for us. Down the track, we do wish to have custom boxes made which again will save us time.  Currently we use standard boxes and custom labels for all our nougat boxes (and all done by hand!).
  3. We would also like to consolidate all our online stores into one webpage that would incorporate an online store, news of which markets we are attending, brag page and all store locations that our product will be available at.
  4. And, if there is any funds left over, we would like to upgrade some of our kitchen equipment.

So what do my sweet eaters get in return?

What ever sweet amount you decide to pledge, you will receive either boxes of our sweet nougat or vouches redeemable for Eat Sweet goods. 

For every level of pledges, your sweet bonus increases as well. 

How sweet is that!

Now go check out those sweet perks ;)

*Some of our Meringue Kisses

Please, even if you can't contribute (we sweetly understand!!!), pass this on to whomever you think might be able and interested! Please share share share--Facebook, Twitter, the family get together and to all sweet eaters that you know!

Thanks for reading all my sweet eaters!

story:
Hi And Welcome To Our Project


After spending years travelling the world, meeting many lovely people and staying in many hostels, I decided it was time to hang up my backpack and create a beautiful place for travellers to relax and feel at home. 
Our hostel is situated in the Rhodope mountains and looks out upon beautiful hills and landscapes.Rather than going for the standard city hostel, we've created something more natural and ecological for our guests to enjoy.
With the help of many friends and loved ones, we've turned this ruin into a little piece of paradise for all to share.

It's been a long and educational experience and after 8 and a half years, we're now proud to be able to open our doors, the final obstacle being, the legalisation of our project, and this is where all of you come in.


What We Need Your Help For:


Over the course of creating this place, we've now spent every penny, sweated every bead of sweat and bled every drop of blood we could spare.

We now need to raise €15000  to pay for  the  electric, fire, water, health and engineering inspections and documentation, as well as an architect to draw it all up and the purchase of all the necessary fire equipment, from sensors to a fire door and extinguishers.

By donating you can choose from one of our lovely perks. Or alternately, if you're never intending to make it to our place, you can donate and  just go down in the HHH world of fame, where songs will be sung of you, and you'll not be forgotten.


Our Impact:


While our project isn't likely to change the world, we'd like to hope that we can slightly alter the lives of those who come here through great experiences, outdoor activities, good food , as well as bonding and learning with nature. 

Risks & Challenges:


While everything that we've built and created has been done with much love and forethought, it is possible that something might not meet the governmental criteria and need changing.  We've allowed € 2000 in our goal to oversee any possible errors that we might have made.  In the case that this doesn't occur the money will be spent on upgrading our barnyard as well as building a stable for our new baby horse.
If our campaign goes viral and we go way over our goal, there are many good things to spend any additional funds on, such as solar panels, wind turbines, solar and grey water systems, yoga temple, additional farm land and  more.
Solar panels     ;    15,000€
Wind turbine     ;    12,000€
Grey water sys ;     5,000€
Yoga temple     ;     5,000€

Other Ways You Can Help:


Even if you cant afford to help us financially, your support by sharing our project with the world could be a crucial part of our success.
Please share the hell out of it :)

Over the course of creating this place, we've now spent every penny, sweated every bead of sweat and bled every drop of blood we could spare.

We now need to raise €15000  to pay for  the  electric, fire, water, health and engineering inspections and documentation, as well as an architect to draw it all up and the purchase of all the necessary fire equipment, from sensors to a fire door and extinguishers.
By donating you can choose from one of our lovely perks. Or alternately, if you're never intending to make it to our place, you can donate and  just go down in the HHH world of fame, where songs will be sung of you, and you'll not be forgotten.


Our Impact:



While our project isn't likely to change the world, we'd like to hope that we can slightly alter the lives of those who come here through great experiences, outdoor activities, good food , as well as bonding and learning with nature. 

    Risks & Challenges:

While everything that we've built and created has been done with much love and forethought, it is possible that something might not meet the governmental criteria and need changing.  We've allowed € 2000 in our goal to oversee any possible errors that we might have made.  In the case that this doesn't occur the money will be spent on upgrading our barnyard as well as building a stable for our new baby horse.

If our campaign goes viral and we go way over our goal, there are many good things to spend any additional funds on, such as solar panels, wind turbines, solar and grey water systems, yoga temple, additional farm land and  more.

Solar panels     ;    15,000€
Wind turbine     ;    12,000€
Grey water sys ;     5,000€
Yoga temple     ;     5,000€

    Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you cant afford to help us financially, your support by sharing our project with the world could be a crucial part of our success.
Please share the hell out of it :)

story:
Summary

The first ever Ohio Made Awards will celebrate Ohio makers, business owners, food artisans, inventors, and entrepreneurs. Awards will be presented in eight categories to Ohio companies for their outstanding achievements and to Ohio business owners for their career achievements and extraordinary contributions to their community. 

What We Need & What You Get

The first ever Ohio Made Awards will be the largest event of the year for Ohio Creative Collective, a nonprofit dedicated to provided opportunities for Ohio small business owners. We are looking for donations, and event sponsorship to assist with the cost to put on the event. We are also looking to raise money to use towards providing monetary prizes that will go to the award recipients to be used towards advancing their businesses. 

We have a lot of perks for those who donate ranging from event tickets to  event and award sponsors. We appreciate your support! 

Any funds raised above and beyond our goal will be used towards future events benefiting Ohio small business owners and/or used as prize money for Ohio Made Award recipients. 

The Impact

Ohio Creative Collective's desire is to bring about a sense of community in an industry that is often not treated as an industry.

  • Small businesses/small business owners from all over the state will be recognized for their achievements. 
  • The Ohio Made Awards will connect Ohio entrepreneurs 
  • The Ohio Made Awards will celebrate Ohio makers 

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether or not you make a contribution to our campaign, please take a moment to share the campaign and help us raise awareness for the first ever Ohio Made Awards.

We are also looking to raise money to use towards providing monetary prizes that will go to the award recipients to be used towards advancing their businesses.

story:
What's Happening?

The air pollution, or haze extends across the regions in Sumatra Indonesia, even to Singapore and Malaysia. The worst of it has been in Jambi and Riau. 

CNN recently reports:

  • The air pollution index in Pekanbaru, Riau has been hazardous hovering above 1,000 for over a week. Actually anything over 200 is unhealthy.
  • Local authorities decide to keep primary and secondary schools closed as smoke haze worsens.
  • More than 35,000 people have fallen ill from the air pollution in the three months by the end of September.
  • Infants and mothers from poor families are severely affected because the air pollution inside their homes is similar to that outside.
My friend's family in Jambi similarly shares that in the hospital, many people suffer from a respiratory infection, and even a failure. 

An image from Liputan6


Healthy individuals need to wear a N95 mask if the pollutant standards index rises to above 300. Some organizations, like IDI, FIM, and IAGI had done something wonderful for the public by distributing N95 masks. But, people in Jambi and Riau still need MORE, because... there are far too many out there who need it. As you may have noticed in the pictures, some people wear no personal protective equipment; some of them just wear common face masks which will not provide sufficient protection against haze particles.

This campaign is set up to collect funds so we can purchase face masks of N95 type and deliver them to Jambi and Riau. The priority will be given to the elderly, children, pregnant women, and individuals with pre-existing respiratory and cardiac morbidities.

An image from Reuters


2 Ways You Can Help

  1. Donate. Every dollar counts, because we can use 1 USD to buy 1 mask. 
    • I will send all donation to Indonesia through Transferwise. Then my friends in PCMI Jawa Tengah and PCMI Riau, a youth empowerment organization, will work together to buy N95 masks in Java as the price is cheaper there, and distribute them to Jambi and Riau. [All proceeds will be spent directly in the purchase and delivery of the masks]
  2. Share this campaign link to your friends and families. Some of the donated funds are coming from complete strangers who heard about this via Facebook. 

Thank you so much!

Diana

story:
Who We Are

  • We are a group of four individuals who came together through a YMCA funded youth business program. This inspiring program (the YMB) was where we were first introduced to the YMCA's Strong Kids Campaign.
  • We're reaching out to you, the community, to help us raise funds for children and teens who are facing financial obstacles. These obstacles prevent them from getting the things they need to grow into strong adults, namely activities, friendships, mentors and in some cases food. 
  • Our aim is to raise $600 that will go straight to a child in need.

What We Need

100% of proceeds will go to the Strong Kids Campaign, which in turn will go directly to children, teens, young adults and families in Canada so they can develop their minds and bodies. Here are just a few examples of what your money can do

  • If we work together and raise $120 we can give a vulnerable teen access to one year of the YMCA Youth Leadership Development.
  • $420 will provide healthy meals so he/she can play without hunger
  • $600 will gift a summer camp experience at YMCA Camp Elphinstone.
  • If we don't reach our goal, all the money we have raised will still go towards Strong Kids in order to help in any way that it can.

  • Join us in promoting healthy kids as well! Hashtag #YhelpingY by clicking here to show your own healthy meal or what you like to do to keep fit!

The Impact

The YMCA is a non profit that works hard every year to try and raise enough money for all the kids that apply. Unfortunately, despite the YMCA contributing as much as they can and even employees donating money out of their own pockets, they can't keep up with the amount of children that are in need. However, there are success stories! In order to read them and know more check out these Impact Stories.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Raise some awareness by reposting and liking us on Facebook or hash tagging #YhelpingY on our Instagram

story:
Over 150 children get diagnosed with cancer every year in Kyrgyz Republic

The little girl on the photo Bedelova Aimurok  with her mother, she was diagnosed with cancer in February 2o14 in July, 11,  2o15 she passed away. She didn't get adequate medical care and painkilling when she was dying, she suffered a very long time before she passed away. 

In our country there is no qualified treatment of oncological diseases. No hospices neither access to morphine for children and adults.

Children continue to pass away without palliative care. We urgently need aid to help build and to develop palliative care for children in Kyrgyz Republic. Please spread the word and donate.

What We Need 

We need financial aid for First Children's Hospice and Home Care for children 

The Impact

  • help us to buy Liquid Morphine Drops 

  • help our families feel connected

  • ensure our Home Care Service can continue to be a lifeline for families

  • help us reach more families and to be there for the hundreds of children who may not reach adulthood

What We Do

The group was established in February 2014 on the social networks under name "Helping is easy" to help children with cancer, it became a Public Fund by the end of the same year.

The Group has raised the problem of violations of human rights, the rights of patients in the children's department of National Oncology Center. With the joint efforts of the NGOs, journalists, and the Ministry of Health situation has changed. Instead, one doctor and one nurse, now in this department works  6 doctors and 10 nurses. It became possible to send doctors to Moscow, Almaty, Tashkent for trainings.  We are one of the organizers of a conference on Children's Hematology to be held in September this year. We invited leading professors from Germany and Russia. Step-by-step we are helping to solve the problem in children oncology department. 

What we have done:

• Handed 40 beds and mattresses, to the Oncology Center. 

• Attracted financial support $ 10 000 to purchase a clavicular catheters for children

• Attracted financial support $ 10 000 to purchase of medicines and oxygen concentrators

• Attracted financial support $ 10 000 to purchase of medicines for chemotherapy

• Attracted financial support to purchase anesthesia machine, $ 2 000 

• Attracted financial support to purchase an anesthetic creams, sprays, $3000 

• Painless needle for daily blood tests, $ 600

• Mobile rack for droppers, $ 300

• Curtains $ 300

• Flooring playground $ 300

• Outdoor playground $ 3,000

• Computer for doctors, $ 200

• Heater, $ 50

• Microwave

• Attracted financial support to pay for analyzes on the amount of $ 5570

• For children from poor families purchased medicines worth bollee $6000

• Purchase gifts for 80 children, the project "Dreams Come True", tablets, bicycles and others toys

• Assistance with free internet to the children department

• Attracted financial support to pay for air tickets for doctors training in Moscow

• Paid consultation  fee of invited professor of pediatric oncology from Belarus

• Travel and accomodation expenses paid for 2 doctors on the Conference in Uzbekistan 

• Paid training fee and accomodation for 2 doctors in Almaty

• 46,000 Euro were collected for the children treatment abroad

• Attracted financial support to buy and install an air-conditioners valued at more than US $ 3000

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
About Black Rock Legal Defense Fund

Black Rock Legal Defense Fund was established in 2012 to counter-balance overbearing law enforcement practices inconsistent with the letter & spirit of the law, and offensive to upright standards of decency and justice with particular emphasis on the fourth and eighth amendments.

Not just another Civil Rights group

While advocacy and lobbying fall within the scope of BRLDF’s mission, this organization aims to affect change in the most direct, proactive, and value driven manner possible – by hiring attorneys to defend the disadvantaged from criminal prosecution incommensurate with their actual violations. Because competent representation can make the difference between a minor inconvenience, and a life altering event of profound significance.

Legal Defense Fund

The Black Rock Legal Defense Fund is a unique account that can be tapped for providing individual citizens with legal or direct financial assistance. Application to the fund is approved by either a small committee or the national board, depending on the level of assistance sought. The committee works throughout the year raising funds for LDF.

Purpose of the Fund

The Black Rock Legal Defense Fund collects and distributes contributions for aiding citizens in defending the freedom from excessive bail, fines, punishment, unreasonable searches or seizures as guaranteed by the Eighth and Fourth Amendments of the United States Constitution.

The primary role of the Legal Defense Fund is to support the defense of disadvantaged individuals facing egregiously exaggerated criminal prosecution, which can be the most expensive way to defend the Eighth and Fourth Amendments. The fund can also be a source of support for coalitions and newsletters, as well as for legislative lobbying activities aimed at protecting individuals & their civil rights from overbearing intrusion by government authority.

All requests from the Legal Defense Fund will be weighed with special consideration for activities that will effect the most far-reaching and positive outcomes.

Community Service

Black Rock Legal Defense fund offers those sentanced to community service the unique opportunity to satisfy that requirement building the infrastructure to advocate for a more humane and rational criminal justice system.

How will the money from this fundraiser be used?

The registration process is complicated, rigorous, and if applications are not prepared with exact precision, they will be denied. Black Rock LDF will engage the service of a professional registration company, with a 100% success record.

100% of the money generated by this fundraiser will be applied to registration fees and expenses associated with obtaining IRS 501 (c) (3), a critical designation that will enable the LDF to properly engage its philanthropic mission to help protect the most vulnerable from victimization.

100% Charity, 100% Transparency

$1,700 : the price of document preparation & filing, for both Nevada and Federal.
$450 - 850 : federal fees to register as a 501 (c) (3) non-profit.
$250 : Registered Agent expense, per year, in Nevada.
$300 : 10% (at least) that indiegogo is going to take.
$3,100, so Minus $100.

Anyone and everyone is welcome to double check these figures. They were provided by The Company Corporation. They specialize in this sort of thing, their website is "incorporate.com", and you can call them up at (302) 636.5440 to double check for yourself.

If you know how to get it done less expensively, please contact us directly.

Participate in the creation of a force for good.

If you haven't been paying attention these past few years, the United States is experiencing an epidemic of police misconduct, abuse of authority, and brutality. We're on track for 2015 to surpass 1,000 American citizens killed by the police.

If you have, you might find it troubling. Maybe it even bothers you enough to make a facebook post. But then, you move along. Nothing changes, and then a week, or a month, or a day later, another something terrible happens. But it's the same old terrible. Is that the kind of world you want to live in?

You ever wish there was something you could do about it?

Well, guess what. You can. If this rising tide of enterprise corruption is ever going to be pushed down, it's going to take action. And money.

Let's be realistic here, it's very difficult to get anything done without money. Black Rock Legal Defense Fund has been operating in the red since 2012. Its gone as far as it can on a zero budget, and certainly isn't capable of fulfilling the potential of its mission. Every dollar counts, but if you've got more enthusiasm than finances, and want to contribute, we'll find a place for you.

Black Rock Legal Defense Fund thanks you for your support.

story:
You can continue to fund our campaign. Find our bank information here.

Unterstütze unsere Kampagne weiterhin. Zu den Bankverbindungen.

Video mit Deutschen Untertiteln


Did you know that ...

  • 1/3 of prostitutes started to sell their body at 12 to 14 years of age!
  • There are about 1 Million client visits to brothels every month here in Israel!
  • About 68% of prostitutes suffer from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder!
  • 89% to 92% of prostitutes would like to leave prostitution, but can't!

A.I.R. 

A.I.R. is a social impact business that produces and sells trendy, stylish Swiss-Israeli designed and locally manufactured furniture, made out of European shipping pallets. The sole purpose of this business is to provide employment for individuals escaping exploitation in the Israeli sex industry. Our employees will be supported on the job, by professional social workers and carpenters. This will ensure they are given the best opportunity for full personal restoration, and will guarantee that the furniture we produce will be of the highest quality. www.madebyair.com

Our team is built of international and local staff and volunteers who are in Tel Aviv and ready to go! 


Our business is based on a five year plan. In order to begin, A.I.R. requires a start-up capital of $634,000. We have raised 56% of that amount through a loan. The remaining $279,000 is where you come in!!! Through your donation and support, we invite you to be part of the restoration of women who have been exploited in the sex industry in Israel. Together, we will offer them stable salaries, professional support regarding their every day emotional and practical challenges, and training in the design, carpentry, sewing, internet marketing and sales industries. 


What We Need 

The money raised will be used to start-up A.I.R. centre which will include renting and renovating our production hub, paying utilities,  purchasing machinery, and meeting other costs such as marketing, insurances and more. The majority of funds raised will be used to pay salaries to the women participating in the program who have come out of prostitution. We will pay them an average Israeli salary, enabling them to achieve financial independence. Funds raised will also enable us to employ carpenters, social workers, psychologists, a massage therapist, a salesman and a manager.

First Year                                       Months     Amount     Number    Total

  • Set Up                                     one time   60,000      1                   60,000
  • Employees                            monthly    3,333          4                  160,000
  • Women's salaries               monthly    1,300          5                   78,000
  • Rent, utilities, insurance  monthly    6,167           1                   74,000

Any and every dollar we receive will go towards the start-up of A.I.R, even if we don't reach our entire goal. For Instance:

  • $1,300 USD covers the monthly salary for a woman exiting the sex industry.
  • $3,500 USD will fund the monthly rent for our production hub.
  • $16,000 USD covers six months of utilities & insurance for our production hub.
  • $40,000 USD will enable us to employ a qualified social worker for one year.
  • $60,000 USD  covers most of the set up costs for our 600m² production hub.


The Impact

Most women attempting to exit the destructive cycle of commercial sexual exploitation are hindered by a lack of financial support and alternative employment options. Consultation with community and government services in Israel, has confirmed that there is a great need for realistic employment opportunities for women exiting the sex industry here. 

A.I.R. will provide employment rehabilitation, in a secure environment, for a season, until each individual is ready to move on to a more independent job.  

The success of our program is dependent upon A.I.R. becoming a self sustaining business. To begin, we need your help, but through market research and profit analysis, we are confident that A.I.R. will become self sustaining by the third year of operations. Our confidence was further boosted by the strong customer demand and interest that was generated when we recently delivered a pilot production of furniture to a local cafe in Tel Aviv, called "Bundle". 


Risks & Challenges

Many people ask us "how will women work in carpentry?" What many people don't know is that (A) carpentry is so much more than cutting wood - it includes sanding, oiling, designing, attaching accessories and much more, (B) it is SO therapeutic to work with your hands in a peaceful environment and so rewarding to see the finished product being used by happy customers, and (C) anyone can do it, with little or much skill. 

Palette furniture is essentially a new product in the Israeli furniture market and as such, there is always the possibility that the market might not respond as anticipated. Having said this, the strong interest and demand we experienced in relation to our pilot production, gives us every reason to feel confident that we will achieve strong sales.

Even though this is A.I.R’s first startup business, we are basing our model on similar social impact businesses, which have already been successfully operating for several years in Switzerland. These businesses also successfully employ disadvantaged and marginalised people, both male and female. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, we'd love you to be a part of what we are doing anyway! You can help us get the word out. You know people we don't! Feel free to share this on any of your media tools :)

You can continue to fund our campaign. Find our bank information here.Unterstütze unsere Kampagne weiterhin. Zu den Bankverbindungen.Video mit Deutschen UntertitelnDid you know that ...

1/3 of prostitutes started to sell their body at 12 to 14 years of age!


There are about 1 Million client visits to brothels every month here in Israel!


About 68% of prostitutes suffer from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder!


89% to 92% of prostitutes would like to leave prostitution, but can't!

A.I.R. A.I.R. is a social impact business that produces and sells trendy, stylish Swiss-Israeli designed and locally manufactured furniture, made out of European shipping pallets. The sole purpose of this business is to provide employment for individuals escaping exploitation in the Israeli sex industry. Our employees will be supported on the job, by professional social workers and carpenters. This will ensure they are given the best opportunity for full personal restoration, and will guarantee that the furniture we produce will be of the highest quality. www.madebyair.com
Our team is built of international and local staff and volunteers who are in Tel Aviv and ready to go! Our business is based on a five year plan. In order to begin, A.I.R. requires a start-up capital of $634,000. We have raised 56% of that amount through a loan. The remaining $279,000 is where you come in!!! Through your donation and support, we invite you to be part of the restoration of women who have been exploited in the sex industry in Israel. Together, we will offer them stable salaries, professional support regarding their every day emotional and practical challenges, and training in the design, carpentry, sewing, internet marketing and sales industries. What We Need 
The money raised will be used to start-up A.I.R. centre which will include renting and renovating our production hub, paying utilities,  purchasing machinery, and meeting other costs such as marketing, insurances and more. The majority of funds raised will be used to pay salaries to the women participating in the program who have come out of prostitution. We will pay them an average Israeli salary, enabling them to achieve financial independence. Funds raised will also enable us to employ carpenters, social workers, psychologists, a massage therapist, a salesman and a manager.First Year                                       Months     Amount     Number    Total
Set Up                                     one time   60,000      1                   60,000
Employees                            monthly    3,333          4                  160,000
Women's salaries               monthly    1,300          5                   78,000
Rent, utilities, insurance  monthly    6,167           1                   74,000
Any and every dollar we receive will go towards the start-up of A.I.R, even if we don't reach our entire goal. For Instance:
$1,300 USD covers the monthly salary for a woman exiting the sex industry.
$3,500 USD will fund the monthly rent for our production hub.
$16,000 USD covers six months of utilities & insurance for our production hub.
$40,000 USD will enable us to employ a qualified social worker for one year.
$60,000 USD  covers most of the set up costs for our 600m² production hub.
The Impact
Most women attempting to exit the destructive cycle of commercial sexual exploitation are hindered by a lack of financial support and alternative employment options. Consultation with community and government services in Israel, has confirmed that there is a great need for realistic employment opportunities for women exiting the sex industry here. A.I.R. will provide employment rehabilitation, in a secure environment, for a season, until each individual is ready to move on to a more independent job.  The success of our program is dependent upon A.I.R. becoming a self sustaining business. To begin, we need your help, but through market research and profit analysis, we are confident that A.I.R. will become self sustaining by the third year of operations. Our confidence was further boosted by the strong customer demand and interest that was generated when we recently delivered a pilot production of furniture to a local cafe in Tel Aviv, called "Bundle". 
Risks & Challenges
Many people ask us "how will women work in carpentry?" What many people don't know is that (A) carpentry is so much more than cutting wood - it includes sanding, oiling, designing, attaching accessories and much more, (B) it is SO therapeutic to work with your hands in a peaceful environment and so rewarding to see the finished product being used by happy customers, and (C) anyone can do it, with little or much skill. 
Palette furniture is essentially a new product in the Israeli furniture market and as such, there is always the possibility that the market might not respond as anticipated. Having said this, the strong interest and demand we experienced in relation to our pilot production, gives us every reason to feel confident that we will achieve strong sales.
Even though this is A.I.R’s first startup business, we are
basing our model on similar social impact businesses, which
have already been successfully operating for several years
in Switzerland. These businesses also successfully employ
disadvantaged and marginalised people, both male and female. 




Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute financially, we'd love you to be a part of what we are doing anyway! You can help us get the word out. You know people we don't! Feel free to share this on any of your media tools :)

story:
Our daughter Marlo was recently in the hospital for a few days with a minor infection (she is TOTALLY FINE). We were only there for a few days, but we can tell you for sure that being in the hospital sucks for kids. If you're hooked up to IVs or are really sick you can't run or play; your friends aren't there and neither are your toys; there's not much to do.  We read Marlo's favorite book, La Pequeña y Grande Frida, over an over (in between Yo Gabba Gabba episodes!).  

Our goal is simple.  We want to put 50 copies of this awesome book into the hands of sick kids in Hospital Universitario Fundación Jiménez in Madrid.  The publisher is giving us a 50% discount, so we only need to raise 400 Euros (about $440 USD).  

We think it's a great choice because it depicts Frida Kahlo's creative awakening while she was hospitalized and the brilliance of a person who lived with many disabilities throughout her life. It's a happy and beautiful book, and we want to share it with other kids - many of whom will stay in the hospital for longer and with more serious battles than ours.

Anything raised over our goal will go towards buying copies of this book for Spanish speaking kids in Miami Children's Hospital, in honor of a family friend who has had to spend far too much time there.

Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

We are Align8, LLC, established in March 2014 to collaborate years of experience in the event planning industry: booth events, catering, directing, venues, bridal shows, etc. We are local Entrepreneurs who share a desire to have a location of our own and a dream to have something lasting.  Our focus is to build a business not only for ourselves, but to extend an opportunity to others who desire the same.  We want…more…excellence…sustainability.

We’ve spent the past 2 years planning and preparing for this opportunity together.  We've spent many more years dreaming of this day. We’ve had conversations with business owners and entrepreneurs in the event planning industry who are tired of competing with each other for every contract.  We are working with architects and design teams to giver us a building we will all admire.  

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to move to the next phase in making this Venue a reality. You can buy yourself a party or just buy a gift card to use at the Venue for food, party room or any of the services offered by our Sponsors. Please be generous. Purchase for yourself and a Friend. OR, just make a donation.

We have a desire to live the true definition of being a part of a collaborative TEAM: “Having members with complementary skills to generate synergy through a coordinated effort which allows each member to maximize their strengths and minimize their weaknesses.”

With support already expressed from very impressive affiliations (hotels & other businesses), we know that becoming a top-notch events venue in the Hampton Roads area (and this is just the beginning) is almost a guarantee.   At this facility, our Team's competitor is our Team...to always deliver better than our last event.

OUR VISION

To strive and deliver every event effortlessly.

OUR MISSION

To serve our community by delivering a level of service that ensures excellence and inspires all evolved to exhibit extraordinary respect and build relationships with each opportunity

OUR GOALS

  • To foster an environment of non-competing businesses.
  • To offer our clients an excellent level of service.
  • To become a prime events venue in the Hampton Roads area.
  • To coordinate professional individuals with a desire to build a collaborative events planning venue.

What We Need & *What You Get 

Full-service commercial kitchen...........................$70,000.   

Invisible seam Retractable Walls & Lighting........$30,000.

Table, chairs, linen and other dining decor..........$25,000.

Our goal is to serve from 10-450 guests at any given event and up to 5 events at once.

Since we are not taking over an existing event facility, we will also need to purchase all of our banquet room furnishings, utensils, linens and everything else to make you feel special when you enter our space. 

And lastly, we must ensure that our staff are the best trained in every area: Servers, Wait Staff, Janitors, Dishwashers, Security, Sales, Greeters, Customer Service, Managers and Administrators. As Martin Luther King, Jr said, "If a man is call a Street Sweeper, he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted...".

  • We are asking you to support us by participating in our Campaign.  

Our goal is to ensure that everyone who supports us receives benefit beyond your purchase by providing outstanding service when you visit our facility. Here are some of our other great PERKS:

  • FREE Movie Tickets, Food Coupons, our Logo T-shirts & more
  • Tickets to our Signature Events
  • Complimentary Dining in our on-site Coffee Lounge or Sandwich Shop
  • Private Parties for you and your Guests
  • An Invitation to our Grand-Opening Appreciation Mixer
  • Certificates/Gift Cards with INCREDIBLE DISCOUNTS on YOUR event
  • Professional 'head-shots' from our onsite photographers
  • FREE SPA or Floral Design
  • Our deepest and heart-felt THANK YOU's!!!!!

*ALL SPECIFIC DETAILS WILL BE SHARED AND GIFTS DISTRIBUTED AT OUR "GRAND-OPENING APPRECIATION MIXER". Please include your contact information when making your purchase.

The Impact

We are offering Event business sources in one location, catering to all genres of events. Our personalized services are tailored to your event complemented with convenience and flexibility. Our business is a unique approach and will be a resource to the event planning industry that allows Vendors to provide their Specialty services in one location. Our customers will have their dream event without the stress of dealing with so many different contracts.

Furthermore, we will contribute to the city’s economy by employing approximately 30 – 50 service industry employees thus increasing consumer spending. Our business will be a vibrant attraction to and located in a prominent, convenient and growing section of the city.

Our goal is to be operational by Fall 2016 with a celebration to appreciate all of our Supporters.  We need your support to make this happen.


Risks & Challenges

As with any new business, there are always challenges beyond budgets.  The Align8 Team has been in planning and execution mode for nearly two (2) years. Although we can't foresee every obstacle, we have a strong commitment to ourselves, our investors, our supporters...and an Advisory Team that will guide us through any obstacle to become a main events venue in Virginia. Again, we need your support to make it  happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your monetary support, which gives us the solid foundation we need to move forward, we would really appreciate your help in:

  • Getting the word out and making a loud noise about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Posting our campaign link on your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn pages and ALL other social media outlets that you use every day.
  • Challenging your family, friends and business partners to Meet or Beat Your Level of Support. 
  • $125,000 is our goal for this campaign but we really need to sell every Perk we are offering and we need your help to do it.  WE cannot do it without YOU!
  • SPECIAL PURCHASE: If you're planning a small informal party for late 2016 or any time in 2017, this is for you:  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/avenues8-a-s...

FOR BUSINESS SPONSORS...

We believe that those fortunate enough to be chosen to be a part of this growing team will bring with them an attitude to grow, inspire, enhance, encourage, promote and empower each other to stretch beyond their perceived limitations. We hope that their aspirations will be amplified through our collaborative efforts and their connection with Align8, LLC.

How do you become a part of this TEAM?

  1. If you’re in the Events business and this collaborative effort starts you to Dream again of ideas you've had for your business, you should talk to us.
  2. If you’ve always wanted a ‘brick and mortar’ but couldn’t do it by yourself, you should talk to us.
  3. If you’ve wanted to collaborate with other like-minded entrepreneurs to create something bigger than yourself, you should have a talk with us. 
Talking…that’s how it starts. 

We are looking for Owners of the following business types: Florist, Event Planner, Photographer, Videographer, Decorator/Rental Company, Limousine/Car Service,  Entertainment/DJ Service, Lighting, Caterer, Cake Decorator. Event Director and a Salon Manager looking to open his/her own salon.

If you’re interested in getting more information on how you can be a part of this great Collaborative adventure, show your support by purchasing the Introduce YOUR Business perk, (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/avenues8-a-s...) then we will send you a link to review and choose your Sponsoring Level. Hurry...there are only 10 Business Perks available.
