story:
Imagine any small business trying to survive after losing forty percent of its inventory.  40% every year.  Now imagine that small business is responsible for your food supply. 

Please join us in creating an organization to help the honeybees, and the beekeepers charged with their well being.

  • As an introduction, I’m a small suburban beekeeper with 9 colonies of honeybees, I’ve learned more about beekeeping every year.  I’ve also learned more about the problems honeybees face, and the challenging economics of a being a beekeeper

  • The reason someone becomes a beekeeper is simple.  They love the honey bees.  If you need proof, ask a beekeeper about his/her honeybees and two hours later they’ll still be talking!

  • We can greatly help the honeybees by providing support to those who know our honeybees best; the beekeepers.

  • With this effort, I’m trying to leverage the broad social reach of the internet to gain support from people who care.  People like you.  People who care about the honeybees, about their beekeepers, and about pollinators and their food supply in general.

 Here’s how we’re going to do it.

The effort to launch More Honeybees!! Will include 3 phases;

Phase 1 - Support the fall honey harvest and sales (Fall 2016).

During the fall beekeepers collect and extract honey.  Their best chance at success for the year is to sell their product to people who understand the value of good, high quality local honey.  This isn’t the mass produced, processed syrup, that sold in stores.  Our beekeepers provide a superior, hive to bottle, healthier product.

Many of our perks are designed so you aid beekeepers by purchasing their product AND you get healthy, delicious honey by contributing.

Phase 2 - Supporting the Spring beekeeping season (Spring 2017).

As we gain momentum we’ll use proceeds of honey sales, and other donations to purchase honeybees and beehives for direct donation to beekeepers.

The honeybees will be purchased from small, local, breeders promotion biodiversity and honeybees better suited to the local region.  Often beekeepers can only afford to purchase honeybees from larger producers.  These honeybees are shipped across the country which promotes the spread of disease and honeybees who might not be suited to survive a winter.

Phase 3 - Education and Partnership (Mid-2017 & Ongoing).

As we continue to build a network of beekeepers and consumers who care, we’ll leverage a number of partners to provide education on best practices to ensure survivability of the honeybees.

You’ll notice all of the perks below directly support this program and provide you with a tasty benefit.

 Our Perks!

The perks are set to allow you to help in anyway you can.  Either share a dollar and your support, or help us launch a new apiary(bee yard).  Regardless of the level of your contribution, your involvement will move us forward.


$1 - Show you care

If every visitor contributed $1 we'd be on our way.  Every dollar helps.  If our other perks do not interest you, please donate a dollar.  Your dollar will show you care.

You'll also receive a "Thank You" and be included on future updates, so you'll be able to participate and be recognized in our success

More Honeybees T-Shirt

With an awesome, super cool, t-shirt you'll be able to show your support for the honeybees and look snazzy at the same time!

Honeybee Photographic Prints
Working with Denise Yager Photography, we’ve created high quality professional prints of our honeybees in action.  

These prints show the lovable little honeybees visiting flowers pollinating, and working in the hive.  In sets of 3-5 the prints will make awesome wall decor displaying your love for nature and inspiring conversation.

1lb Jar of Quality Local Honey
Honey is often sold in Queenline 1lb Glass Jars.  We’ll work with beekeepers in your local area to provide you with the superior honey only your local beekeepers can provide.  

Local honey is better for you, and supplying a local honey product is better for the environment.  Every jar of honey purchased supports your local beekeeper, and helps the honeybees in your area.  Now that’s a sweet deal!

Hive Share
This is your chance to own a share of your very own honeybee hive.  We’re offering a ⅙ share, ¼ share, or ½ share of a honeybee hive.


You’ll get a photograph of your hive, the beekeeper managing the hive, and quarterly updates on the status of the colony from your beekeeper.
And the best part; You’ll also get a proportional share of any honey produced by the colony.  A ⅙ share typically equates to 6-7lbs of honey, ¼ share is around 10lbs of honey, and ½ share is around 20lbs.  That’s a lot of honey!

Note: depending on the success of the colony you may received more or less honey.

Bring On The Honeybees!
Here’s where you can really make a difference.  Annual honeybee losses are high enough to kill a beekeeping operation.  We need to support those who care for honeybees.  

You can help to contribute a 3lb package of honeybees to a local beekeeper in your area.  Locally sourced honeybees do not need to shipped across the country.  This causes less stress on the honeybees, and reduces the likelihood of the spread of pests and disease.  They also increase the odds that the honeybees will survive in your native regional environment.

Give A Bee A Home - Contribute a new beehive
The biggest expense a beekeeper faces is the cost of new equipment.  You can help defray this cost by contributing to the cost of a beehive.  This directly helps the beekeepers stay in business, and start the season out right.  

The beekeeper will use the hive to add new colonies to their Apiary (bee yard) or to replace old, worn out equipment.

Build an Apiary & Visit an Apiary
Sometimes you just go big.  With this perk you’ll build a brand new apiary (bee yard) We’ll work with local beekeepers to source a location for two new hives that you’ve sponsored.  By adding two new colonies to your area you’re ensuring diversity and helping the local pollinators.

We’ll also arrange a visit to an Apiary in your neighborhood.  This will give you time to speak with a beekeeper and see your local honeybees in action.

You should know… we’ve set an aggressive goal to get More Honeybees launched.  Even if we don’t hit our goal, the funds collected will be used for their intended purpose, helping honeybees and their keepers.

 The Impact

Your food supply is directly dependent on the honeybees.  By participating in our effort you are standing up to say honeybees matter.  Every dollar raised will help the honeybees in your area:

  • Donating honeybees to a local beekeeper adds pollinators to your local ecology.

  • Donating honeybees also supports local honeybee breeders which reduces the likelihood of spreading disease and pests by shipping honeybees across the country.

  • Finally, donating honeybees also helps a beekeeper offset the costs of replacing honeybees lost during the prior season.

  • Providing beekeepers with new equipment helps to support beekeepers, who are the people that love honeybees most and physically work the hardest to support them.

  • It’s all good for the industry, for the honeybees, for local pollination, and for your food supply.

If we’re successful, your local area will have more honeybees, better able to survive in your area, with a stronger beekeeper community to help take care of them.  Doing this across the nation will support pollinators and protect your food supply.

 Risks & Challenges

In any new venture there are always risks and challenges.  The trick is to identify the troublespots and put plans in place to mitigate them.

  • If a tree falls in the woods and no one hears it…We’re counting on the social power of the internet to get the word out.  That means you.  If we launch this effort, and no one shares, no one knows, our impact will be minimal.  Please share this page, encourage your friends to share, and share it again.  You’re key to our success!

  • Our intent is to source our honey and honeybees from beekeepers close to you.  This supports your local ecology.  However, if we can’t find someone in your neighborhood we’ll do our best to get as close as possible.

  • What if we’re wildly successful??Too much too soon can also be a problem, but that’s a problem we’d like to face!  With 25 years of operational experience, we know how to deliver.  We’re confident we can contact enough beekeepers to keep you in honey!

 Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute.  We understand that.  But that doesn't mean they can't help.

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our efforts.  Please share this page, and encourage others to share it as well.

  • If you have a skill set you think will help, please contact us about volunteering.  We’re always looking for more volunteers to help pick up the cause.

Our honeybees and our food supply is depending on your effort and participation.  Thank you for being part of the team.
story_txt:
Imagine any small business trying to survive after losing forty percent of its inventory.  40% every year.  Now imagine that small business is responsible for your food supply. 

Please join us in creating an organization to help the honeybees, and the beekeepers charged with their well being.

As an introduction, I’m a small suburban beekeeper with 9 colonies of honeybees, I’ve learned more about beekeeping every year.  I’ve also learned more about the problems honeybees face, and the challenging economics of a being a beekeeper


The reason someone becomes a beekeeper is simple.  They love the honey bees.  If you need proof, ask a beekeeper about his/her honeybees and two hours later they’ll still be talking!
We can greatly help the honeybees by providing support to those who know our honeybees best; the beekeepers.
With this effort, I’m trying to leverage the broad social reach of the internet to gain support from people who care.  People like you.  People who care about the honeybees, about their beekeepers, and about pollinators and their food supply in general.


 Here’s how we’re going to do it.The effort to launch More Honeybees!! Will include 3 phases;Phase 1 - Support the fall honey harvest and sales (Fall 2016).During the fall beekeepers collect and extract honey.  Their best chance at success for the year is to sell their product to people who understand the value of good, high quality local honey.  This isn’t the mass produced, processed syrup, that sold in stores.  Our beekeepers provide a superior, hive to bottle, healthier product.Many of our perks are designed so you aid beekeepers by purchasing their product AND you get healthy, delicious honey by contributing.Phase 2 - Supporting the Spring beekeeping season (Spring 2017).As we gain momentum we’ll use proceeds of honey sales, and other donations to purchase honeybees and beehives for direct donation to beekeepers.The honeybees will be purchased from small, local, breeders promotion biodiversity and honeybees better suited to the local region.  Often beekeepers can only afford to purchase honeybees from larger producers.  These honeybees are shipped across the country which promotes the spread of disease and honeybees who might not be suited to survive a winter.Phase 3 - Education and Partnership (Mid-2017 & Ongoing).As we continue to build a network of beekeepers and consumers who care, we’ll leverage a number of partners to provide education on best practices to ensure survivability of the honeybees.You’ll notice all of the perks below directly support this program and provide you with a tasty benefit. Our Perks!The perks are set to allow you to help in anyway you can.  Either share a dollar and your support, or help us launch a new apiary(bee yard).  Regardless of the level of your contribution, your involvement will move us forward.

$1 - Show you care

If every visitor contributed $1 we'd be on our way.  Every dollar helps.  If our other perks do not interest you, please donate a dollar.  Your dollar will show you care.
You'll also receive a "Thank You" and be included on future updates, so you'll be able to participate and be recognized in our success





More Honeybees T-Shirt



With an awesome, super cool, t-shirt you'll be able to show your support for the honeybees and look snazzy at the same time!




Honeybee Photographic PrintsWorking with Denise Yager Photography, we’ve created high quality professional prints of our honeybees in action.  


These prints show the lovable little honeybees visiting flowers pollinating, and working in the hive.  In sets of 3-5 the prints will make awesome wall decor displaying your love for nature and inspiring conversation.




1lb Jar of Quality Local HoneyHoney is often sold in Queenline 1lb Glass Jars.  We’ll work with beekeepers in your local area to provide you with the superior honey only your local beekeepers can provide.  


Local honey is better for you, and supplying a local honey product is better for the environment.  Every jar of honey purchased supports your local beekeeper, and helps the honeybees in your area.  Now that’s a sweet deal!
